  • LEICESTER CITY VS. NOTTINGHAM FOREST - FOOTBALL MATCH REPORT - OCTOBER 3, 2022 - ESPN

    https://global.espn.com/football/report?gameId=637905

    10/04/2022

    60.71% Shortened!

    You have come to the all new Global edition, for other ESPN editions, click here

    Leicester City's James Maddison scored two first-half goals as they beat promoted Nottingham Forest 4-0 on Monday to move off the bottom of the table with their first Premier League win of the season

    "And to get the performance we did, hopefully we can push on

    "I felt we had a horrendous summer -- that is the reality -- and it continued into the season

    Maddison broke the ice with the first in the 25th minute, his shot from just outside the box deflected in off the arm of Forest defender Scott McKenna, and Harvey Barnes doubled the lead two minutes later with a stellar shot from distance

    It was a stellar all-round display from Maddison, who was disappointed to be overlooked in the latest England squad despite having strong form for much of 2022

    "It's been a bit of a weird position -- we have been bottom of the league, but I have almost been as confident as I have ever been in myself

    The defeat was a fifth in a row for Forest, piling pressure on manager Steve Cooper as he tries to gel a team packed with new signings, and Leicester's first clean sheet in the league this season

    "I'm doing my job

    Min odds, bet and payment method exclusions apply

    More Details Casemiro is a world-class midfielder but is yet to start a league game for his new club

  • 2022 BMW X5 XDRIVE45E M SPORT IN MALAYSIA - FULL GALLERY; LASERLIGHT, 21-INCH WHEELS, PRICED FR RM457K - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2022/10/04/2022-bmw-x5-xdrive45e-m-sport-in-malaysia-gallery/

    10/04/2022

    54.17% Shortened!

    Elsewhere, the pre-update SUV’s 20-inch star-spoke (style 740M) two-tone alloys have been substituted with larger 21-inch Y-spoke (style 741M) units in Orbit Grey

    The X5 also gains rear side airbags to bring the total airbag count to eight, and there’s now Active Protection that closes the windows and sunroof and pre-tensions the seat belts if the car detects an imminent collision

    Unchanged is the Driving Assistant suite with autonomous emergency braking, lane keeping assist and blind spot monitoring, so you still won’t get Level 2 semi-autonomous driving features like adaptive cruise control and lane centring assist

    Standard items include the M Sport package, satin aluminium window trim and roof rails, keyless entry and engine start, Vernasca leather upholstery, Fineline Stripe gloss brown wood trim, a Sensatec faux leather-wrapped dashboard, power-adjustable front seats with driver’s side memory, four-zone climate control, a panoramic sunroof, adaptive air suspension and six-colour ambient lighting

    Other returning features include BMW Live Cockpit Professional that is made up of two 12.3-inch displays (one as a digital instrument cluster and another being a touchscreen for the infotainment system), dual 10.2-inch touchscreens for rear passengers, BMW Display Key, Parking Assist, a hands-free powered tailgate, a 360-degree camera as well as a 16-speaker Harman Kardon surround system

    An electric motor rated at 113 PS (113 hp or 83 kW) and 265 Nm sits between the engine and an eight-speed Steptronic Sport automatic transmission, with the total system output being 394 PS (389 hp) and 600 Nm

    This figure includes a standard two-year, unlimited-mileage warranty, but if you want the five-year, unlimited-mileage extended warranty and service package, the asking price increases to RM480,800

    Why do they refuse to give Malaysian car owners adaptive cruise control?

    If you want to drive that car – buy a BMW You’re kinda right because E300 has adaptive cruise so your driver can chauffeur you around if you trust the system

    450k car with no L2 semi autonomous driving? Lol

    Everything got even laser light, but somehow BMW Malaysia cannot put adaptive cruise control loop must be a donkey from 2010 choosing the specs of Malaysian BMW recent cars Add a comment

    ['bmw', 'car', 'adaptive', 'system', 'drive']

    Elsewhere, the pre-update SUV’s 20-inch star-spoke (style 740M) two-tone alloys have been substituted with larger 21-inch Y-spoke (style 741M) units in Orbit Grey

    The X5 also gains rear side airbags to bring the total airbag count to eight, and there’s now Active Protection that closes the windows and sunroof and pre-tensions the seat belts if the car detects an imminent collision

    Unchanged is the Driving Assistant suite with autonomous emergency braking, lane keeping assist and blind spot monitoring, so you still won’t get Level 2 semi-autonomous driving features like adaptive cruise control and lane centring assist

    Standard items include the M Sport package, satin aluminium window trim and roof rails, keyless entry and engine start, Vernasca leather upholstery, Fineline Stripe gloss brown wood trim, a Sensatec faux leather-wrapped dashboard, power-adjustable front seats with driver’s side memory, four-zone climate control, a panoramic sunroof, adaptive air suspension and six-colour ambient lighting

    Other returning features include BMW Live Cockpit Professional that is made up of two 12.3-inch displays (one as a digital instrument cluster and another being a touchscreen for the infotainment system), dual 10.2-inch touchscreens for rear passengers, BMW Display Key, Parking Assist, a hands-free powered tailgate, a 360-degree camera as well as a 16-speaker Harman Kardon surround system

    An electric motor rated at 113 PS (113 hp or 83 kW) and 265 Nm sits between the engine and an eight-speed Steptronic Sport automatic transmission, with the total system output being 394 PS (389 hp) and 600 Nm

    This figure includes a standard two-year, unlimited-mileage warranty, but if you want the five-year, unlimited-mileage extended warranty and service package, the asking price increases to RM480,800

    Why do they refuse to give Malaysian car owners adaptive cruise control?

    If you want to drive that car – buy a BMW You’re kinda right because E300 has adaptive cruise so your driver can chauffeur you around if you trust the system

    450k car with no L2 semi autonomous driving? Lol

    Everything got even laser light, but somehow BMW Malaysia cannot put adaptive cruise control loop must be a donkey from 2010 choosing the specs of Malaysian BMW recent cars Add a comment

    ['bmw', 'car', 'adaptive', 'system', 'drive']

  • THREE-YEAR-OLD BOY DIES, ALLEGEDLY ABUSED BY FATHER'S FRIEND, FOREIGN MAID

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/03/three-year-old-boy-dies-allegedly-abused-by-father039s-friend-foreign-maid

    10/03/2022, 22:34

    42.11% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Johor police chief Comm Datuk Kamarul Zaman Mamat said police were notified about the incident at Jalan Ria 2 after the victim’s father lodged a report between 10pm and 11pm on Sunday (Oct 2) night

    He added that police arrested the 28-year-old salesman, who had priors, and a 40-year-old Indonesian maid on Monday (Oct 3) afternoon

    “The victim and his younger sibling, who is one year old, has been under the suspect’s care, three months ago,” he said in a press conference

    Comm Kamarul Zaman added that only the victim was abused as the body showed bruise marks and small wounds, while the younger sibling did not suffer any injuries

    He said the body has been sent to Sultanah Aminah Hospital for a post mortem, while the police would bring the two suspects to the Johor Baru magistrate’s court for a remand application

    Comm Kamarul Zaman added the police would investigate the case under Section 302 of the Penal Code for murder

    "This incident is a tragedy, because the victim is a young child who is growing up

    The police will be firm to ensure that guilty parties are brought to justice," he added.

    Report it to us

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['johor', 'year', 'old', 'young', 'police']

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Johor police chief Comm Datuk Kamarul Zaman Mamat said police were notified about the incident at Jalan Ria 2 after the victim’s father lodged a report between 10pm and 11pm on Sunday (Oct 2) night

    He added that police arrested the 28-year-old salesman, who had priors, and a 40-year-old Indonesian maid on Monday (Oct 3) afternoon

    “The victim and his younger sibling, who is one year old, has been under the suspect’s care, three months ago,” he said in a press conference

    Comm Kamarul Zaman added that only the victim was abused as the body showed bruise marks and small wounds, while the younger sibling did not suffer any injuries

    He said the body has been sent to Sultanah Aminah Hospital for a post mortem, while the police would bring the two suspects to the Johor Baru magistrate’s court for a remand application

    Comm Kamarul Zaman added the police would investigate the case under Section 302 of the Penal Code for murder

    "This incident is a tragedy, because the victim is a young child who is growing up

    The police will be firm to ensure that guilty parties are brought to justice," he added.

  • CREDIT SUISSE MARKET TURMOIL DEEPENS AFTER CEO MEMO BACKFIRES

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/credit-suisse-market-turmoil-deepens-110807765.html

    68.57% Shortened!

    That was accompanied by a spike in the cost to insure the bank’s debt against default, which jumped to its highest ever

    At the same time, Credit Suisse again sent around talking points to executives dealing with clients who brought up the credit default swap, according to people with knowledge of the matter

    Sinking Credit Suisse Stock Is a ‘Buy for the Brave,’ Says Citi While those are still far from distressed -- and also part of a broad market selloff -- they signify deteriorating perceptions of creditworthiness for the scandal-hit bank in the current environment

    Credit Suisse declined to comment via a company spokesman

    Credit Suisse’s market capitalization has dropped to around 9.5 billion Swiss francs, meaning any share sale would be highly dilutive to longtime holders

    Bank executives have noted that the firm’s 13.5% CET1 capital ratio at June 30 was in the middle of the planned range of 13% to 14% for 2022

    Regulators in both the UK and Switzerland, who have been keeping a close eye on Credit Suisse since the multi-billion dollar Archegos Capital loss in 2021, continue to monitor the bank’s stability, according to people with knowledge of the matter

    Deutsche Bank saw its credit-default swaps climb, its debt rating downgraded and some clients step back from working with it

    Credit Suisse doesn’t face any one issue on the scale of Deutsche Bank’s $7.2 billion settlement, and its key capital ratio of 13.5% is higher than the 10.8% that the German firm had six years ago

    Credit Suisse’s one-year swaps are still significantly cheaper than five-year ones

    The bank today also decided to postpone its capital increase for a real estate fund amid high volatility in the market

    ['credit', 'suisse', 'bank', 'year', 'capital']

  • CREDIT SUISSE TURMOIL DEEPENS WITH RECORD STOCK, CDS LEVELS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/credit-suisse-ceo-seeks-calm-133223291.html

    57.69% Shortened!

    On Friday, Chief Executive Officer Ulrich Koerner reassured staff that the bank has a “strong capital base and liquidity position” and told employees that he will be sending them a regular update until the firm announces a new strategic plan on Oct

    Koerner, who was named CEO in late July, has had to deal with market speculation, banker exits and capital doubts as he seeks to set a path forward for the troubled Swiss bank

    Credit Suisse’s market capitalization dropped to around 10 billion Swiss francs, meaning any share sale would be highly dilutive to longtime holders

    The market value was above 30 billion francs as recently as March 2021

    Credit Suisse executives have noted that the firm’s 13.5% CET1 capital ratio at June 30 was in the middle of the planned range of 13% to 14% for 2022

    The five-year credit default swaps price of about 250 basis points is up from about 55 basis points at the start of the year and is near their highest on record

    Deutsche Bank saw its credit-default swaps climb, its debt rating downgraded and some clients step back from working with it

    Credit Suisse doesn’t face any one issue on the scale of Deutsche Bank’s $7.2 billion settlement, and its key capital ratio of 13.5% is higher than the 10.8% that the German firm had six years ago

    The stress Deutsche Bank faced in 2016 resulted in the unusual dynamic where the cost of insuring against losses on the lender’s debt for one year surpassed that of protection for five years

    Credit Suisse’s one-year swaps are still significantly cheaper than five-year ones

    16 Last week, Credit Suisse said it’s working on possible asset and business sales as part of its strategic plan which will be unveiled at the end of October

    ['credit', 'suisse', 'market', 'firm', 'bank']

    On Friday, Chief Executive Officer Ulrich Koerner reassured staff that the bank has a “strong capital base and liquidity position” and told employees that he will be sending them a regular update until the firm announces a new strategic plan on Oct

    Koerner, who was named CEO in late July, has had to deal with market speculation, banker exits and capital doubts as he seeks to set a path forward for the troubled Swiss bank

    Credit Suisse’s market capitalization dropped to around 10 billion Swiss francs, meaning any share sale would be highly dilutive to longtime holders

    The market value was above 30 billion francs as recently as March 2021

    Credit Suisse executives have noted that the firm’s 13.5% CET1 capital ratio at June 30 was in the middle of the planned range of 13% to 14% for 2022

    The five-year credit default swaps price of about 250 basis points is up from about 55 basis points at the start of the year and is near their highest on record

    Deutsche Bank saw its credit-default swaps climb, its debt rating downgraded and some clients step back from working with it

    Credit Suisse doesn’t face any one issue on the scale of Deutsche Bank’s $7.2 billion settlement, and its key capital ratio of 13.5% is higher than the 10.8% that the German firm had six years ago

    The stress Deutsche Bank faced in 2016 resulted in the unusual dynamic where the cost of insuring against losses on the lender’s debt for one year surpassed that of protection for five years

    Credit Suisse’s one-year swaps are still significantly cheaper than five-year ones

    16 Last week, Credit Suisse said it’s working on possible asset and business sales as part of its strategic plan which will be unveiled at the end of October

    ['credit', 'suisse', 'market', 'firm', 'bank']

  • PM'S WEEKLY AUDIENCE WITH KING CLOSELY WATCHED OVER DISSOLUTION OF PARLIAMENT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/03/pms-weekly-audience-with-king-closely-watched-over-dissolution-of-parliament

    10/03/2022, 15:35

    50.0% Shortened!

    A meeting is set to take place on Thursday, a day before the government tables its Budget for 2023

    Budget 2023 will be tabled on Friday (Oct 7)

    While the meeting has been scheduled, sources downplayed it, saying this was the Prime Minister's weekly audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong

    Normally, Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob will meet the King on Tuesday or Wednesday morning before the weekly Cabinet meeting

    "The Prime Minister is expected to inform the Yang di-Pertuan Agong on matters involving the Budget which will be tabled the next day (Friday)

    "It is not certain if the Prime Minister will bring up the subject of Parliament dissolution

    That will be up to the Prime Minister," said a source

    Another meeting that will be keenly watched is a gathering of Umno leaders

    The special meeting with the Umno president and the Prime Minister will be held at the World Trade Centre on Tuesday (Oct 4) at 2pm

    An Umno leader said while the agenda of the meeting was not spelled out in the letter, he believes it has something to do with the general election

    "It has to be (about the polls) or why else would the party headquarters want to call for a meeting," he said

    ['prime', 'minister', 'parliament', 'meeting', 'budget']

  • UK'S TRUSS FORCED INTO HUMILIATING TAX U-TURN

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/03/uk039s-truss-and-kwarteng-forced-into-humiliating-tax-u-turn

    10/03/2022, 15:33

    62.5% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Truss, and her finance minister Kwasi Kwarteng, announced a new "growth plan" on Sept

    23 that would cut taxes and regulation, funded by vast government borrowing to snap the economy out of years of stagnant growth

    But the plan triggered a crisis of investor confidence in the government, hammering the value of the pound and government bond prices and jolting global markets to such an extent that the Bank of England had to intervene with a 65 billion pound ($73 billion) programme to shore up the markets

    While the removal of the top rate of tax only made up around 2 billion out of a 45 billion pound tax-cutting plan, it was the most eye-catching element of a fiscal package that was to be funded by government borrowing, with Kwarteng not explaining how it would be paid for in the long-term

    The decision to reverse course is likely to put Truss and Kwarteng under huge pressure, less than four weeks after they came to power

    Kwarteng said he had not considered resigning

    MISTAKEN POLICY Truss, Britain's 47-year-old former foreign minister who took office on Sept

    Truss had also not denied that it would require spending cuts for public services

    dollar since Kwarteng delivered the mini-budget

    It traded up 0.8% on Monday before slipping back as Kwarteng spoke to the BBC

    Government bond yields also remain sharply higher, underscoring the concern among investors about the economy's direction under Britain's new government

    ['truss', 'kwarteng', 'cut', 'tax', 'government']

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Truss, and her finance minister Kwasi Kwarteng, announced a new "growth plan" on Sept

    23 that would cut taxes and regulation, funded by vast government borrowing to snap the economy out of years of stagnant growth

    But the plan triggered a crisis of investor confidence in the government, hammering the value of the pound and government bond prices and jolting global markets to such an extent that the Bank of England had to intervene with a 65 billion pound ($73 billion) programme to shore up the markets

    While the removal of the top rate of tax only made up around 2 billion out of a 45 billion pound tax-cutting plan, it was the most eye-catching element of a fiscal package that was to be funded by government borrowing, with Kwarteng not explaining how it would be paid for in the long-term

    The decision to reverse course is likely to put Truss and Kwarteng under huge pressure, less than four weeks after they came to power

    Kwarteng said he had not considered resigning

    It traded up 0.8% on Monday before slipping back as Kwarteng spoke to the BBC

  • UK'S TRUSS FORCED INTO U-TURN ON TAX AFTER WEEK OF MARKET TURMOIL

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/03/uk039s-truss-and-kwarteng-forced-into-humiliating-tax-u-turn

    10/03/2022, 15:33

    73.81% Shortened!

    Finance minister Kwasi Kwarteng said the decision had been taken with "humility and contrition", after some lawmakers reacted with fury to suggestions that public and welfare spending could be cut to fund tax cuts for the richest

    Addressing the Conservative Party's annual conference where lawmakers and supporters had gathered, Kwarteng acknowledged the turbulence of the last week, but argued the government needed to press ahead with a new course to revive growth

    No more distractions." Truss - elected as prime minister by party members but not the broader public - is seeking to jolt the economy out of its decade of stagnant growth with a 1980s-style plan to cut taxes and regulation, all funded by vast government borrowing

    Signalling a break with "Treasury orthodoxy", she and Kwarteng also fired the most senior official in the government's finance department and released the tax cut plan without accompanying forecasts on how much it would cost

    We just look incompetent now, too." Another party insider said the Conservative government, in power under different leaders for 12 years but with Truss as prime minister only since Sept

    Less than a day after Truss went on BBC television to defend the policy, Kwarteng released a statement early on Tuesday to say he now accepted it had become a distraction

    Truss won the race to replace him after vowing to reignite the economy

    But while defending her tax cut policy on Sunday, she was unable to rule out public spending cuts and restrictions on welfare payments to balance the books

    Britain's Labour Party said the government had destroyed its economic credibility and damaged the economy

    Showing how unpredictable Britain's dominant political party has become, one former minister, Nadine Dorries, who backed Truss as prime minister less than a month ago, now said she must call an election because she has no personal mandate to govern

    The government had previously given a release date of Nov

    ['truss', 'kwarteng', 'cut', 'tax', 'party']

    10/03/2022, 15:03

    70.27% Shortened!

    Finance minister Kwasi Kwarteng said the decision to scrap the top rate tax cut had been taken with "some humility and contrition." Truss and Kwarteng announced a new "growth plan" on Sept

    23 that would cut taxes and regulation, funded by vast government borrowing, to snap the economy out of years of stagnant growth

    But the plan triggered a crisis of investor confidence in the government, hammering the value of the pound and government bond prices and jolting global markets to such an extent that the Bank of England had to intervene with a 65 billion pound ($73 billion) programme to shore up markets

    With the government's credibility damaged, lawmakers in the governing Conservative Party said the reversal was inevitable

    He said he had decided to reverse course in conjunction with the prime minister

    We just look incompetent now, too." Britain's opposition Labour Party said the government had destroyed its economic credibility and damaged trust in the economy

    (0725 GMT) while yields on British government bonds fell

    MISTAKEN POLICY Truss, Britain's 47-year-old former foreign minister who took office on Sept

    She had argued that the government needed a radical plan to rescue the economy and make the country more dynamic, and that she was willing to take unpopular decisions to make it happen

    "We get it and we have listened," Truss said on Twitter

    "UK risk premia will likely only pull back if that is addressed." Conservative lawmakers told Reuters that the government had no choice but to reverse course

  • UK'S TRUSS FORCED INTO TAX U-TURN AFTER MARKET TURMOIL, PARTY REBELLION

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/03/uk039s-truss-and-kwarteng-forced-into-humiliating-tax-u-turn

    10/03/2022, 15:02

    76.09% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Finance minister Kwasi Kwarteng said the decision was taken with "humility and contrition", after some lawmakers from the ruling Conservative Party reacted with fury to suggestions that public and welfare spending could be cut to fund tax cuts for the richest

    No more distractions." Truss - elected as prime minister by party members but not the broader public - is seeking to jolt the economy out of a decade of stagnant growth with a 1980s-style plan to cut taxes and regulation, all funded by vast government borrowing

    Signalling a break with "Treasury orthodoxy", she and Kwarteng also fired the most senior official in the government's finance department and released the tax cut plan without accompanying forecasts on how much it would cost

    We just look incompetent now, too." Another party insider said the Conservative government, in power under different leaders for 12 years but with Truss as prime minister only since Sept

    Less than a day after Truss went on BBC television to defend the policy, Kwarteng released a statement early on Monday to say he now accepted it had become a distraction

    But while defending her tax cut policy on Sunday, she was unable to rule out public spending cuts and restrictions on welfare payments to balance the books

    Kwarteng had previously said he would deliver a fiscal statement on Nov

    23 with details of how he would cut debt alongside full forecasts for economic growth from Britain's independent fiscal watchdog, the Office for Budget Responsibility (OBR)

    The Financial Times said Kwarteng was expected to accelerate publication to later this month, adding that his statement would set out a five-year plan to cut debt, including a squeeze on public spending

    The Labour Party said the government had destroyed its economic credibility and damaged the economy

    ['kwarteng', 'cut', 'tax', 'party', 'say']

  • VETERAN RTM PRESENTER CONSTANCE HASLAM PASSES AWAY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/03/veteran-rtm-presenter-constance-haslam-passes-away

    10/03/2022, 14:04

    45.0% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Constance, better known as Connie, was believed to be in her 70s

    Constance's old friend and fellow radio announcer Patrick Teoh announced the news of her death on his Facebook page Monday (Oct 3)

    "Today, I woke up to the sad news that an old friend, colleague and former radio announcer, Connie Haslam, has departed for the big radio station in the sky

    "Farewell Connie, and keep the music playing up there," wrote Teoh

    May her soul rest in peace." Facebook user Sunny Nah also wrote a tribute to Constance, describing her as an icon

    Constance was known as one of the golden voices of radio and had opted out of service at age 45 after working for 26 years

    In her glittering career, Constance had interviewed Gloria Estafan, Dionne Warwick, Jose Feliciano, Bjorn Borg, the Bee Gees and Omar Sharif

    "For most of us over a certain age, our growing-up years would have been touched by the dulcet tones of Constance Haslam; cheerful and chirpy while delivering request programmes, professional and informative when delivering the news, and warm and friendly during chat shows

    "Hers was the voice you’d like to wake up to or have as a soothing companion during the daily battle with the traffic to work," Kak Teh wrote in her blog post

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['rtm', 'news', 'constance', 'haslam', 'connie']

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Constance, better known as Connie, was believed to be in her 70s

    Constance's old friend and fellow radio announcer Patrick Teoh announced the news of her death on his Facebook page Monday (Oct 3)

    "Today, I woke up to the sad news that an old friend, colleague and former radio announcer, Connie Haslam, has departed for the big radio station in the sky

    "Farewell Connie, and keep the music playing up there," wrote Teoh

    May her soul rest in peace." Facebook user Sunny Nah also wrote a tribute to Constance, describing her as an icon

    Constance was known as one of the golden voices of radio and had opted out of service at age 45 after working for 26 years

    In her glittering career, Constance had interviewed Gloria Estafan, Dionne Warwick, Jose Feliciano, Bjorn Borg, the Bee Gees and Omar Sharif

    "For most of us over a certain age, our growing-up years would have been touched by the dulcet tones of Constance Haslam; cheerful and chirpy while delivering request programmes, professional and informative when delivering the news, and warm and friendly during chat shows

    "Hers was the voice you’d like to wake up to or have as a soothing companion during the daily battle with the traffic to work," Kak Teh wrote in her blog post

  • 5G CONTRACT SHOULD BE GIVEN BACK TO MCMC, SAYS DEPUTY MINISTER

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/03/5g-contract-should-be-given-back-to-mcmc-says-deputy-minister/31363

    10/03/2022, 13:35

    54.17% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 3 — The reason many areas that supposedly should have 5G internet connection still haven't is because the telecommunication companies are not playing ball with the government, Deputy Minister of Communications and Multimedia Datuk Zahidi Zainul Abidin said today

    "First and foremost, please inform the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) if your area has poor internet access

    We at the MCMC give the money to build these transmission stations using government and taxpayers money but the telcos are in charge of fastening the transmitters

    "We at MCMC can only ask them or implore them to place these transmitters to increase the strength of the transmitters while DNB don't have the authority to force them or reprimand them for not doing so

    He encouraged the public to report their poor internet connection

    He said boosting internet signals to rural areas will cost a lot of money

    However this costs money

    We can take money from the SB (statutory bodies) fund or state government money as they have their own multimedia agencies

    The contention over 5G rollout in the country began when the government decided to create DNB, a special purpose vehicle to roll out the network in the country under a single wholesale network model

    After much objection from the telcos who proposed a dual wholesale network to counter the single wholesale network, the government decided to offer a 70 per cent stake in DNB to the players while keeping 30 per cent and holding a golden share

    The deal to take up a stake in DNB also requires shareholders to be 5G access seekers — they must also buy 5G capacity from DNB — with Tengku Zafrul also saying that foreign players were "knocking on our doors" to participate.

    ['area', 'internet', 'government', 'say', 'money']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 3 — The reason many areas that supposedly should have 5G internet connection still haven't is because the telecommunication companies are not playing ball with the government, Deputy Minister of Communications and Multimedia Datuk Zahidi Zainul Abidin said today

    "First and foremost, please inform the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) if your area has poor internet access

    We at the MCMC give the money to build these transmission stations using government and taxpayers money but the telcos are in charge of fastening the transmitters

    "We at MCMC can only ask them or implore them to place these transmitters to increase the strength of the transmitters while DNB don't have the authority to force them or reprimand them for not doing so

    He encouraged the public to report their poor internet connection

    He said boosting internet signals to rural areas will cost a lot of money

    However this costs money

    We can take money from the SB (statutory bodies) fund or state government money as they have their own multimedia agencies

    The contention over 5G rollout in the country began when the government decided to create DNB, a special purpose vehicle to roll out the network in the country under a single wholesale network model

    After much objection from the telcos who proposed a dual wholesale network to counter the single wholesale network, the government decided to offer a 70 per cent stake in DNB to the players while keeping 30 per cent and holding a golden share

    The deal to take up a stake in DNB also requires shareholders to be 5G access seekers — they must also buy 5G capacity from DNB — with Tengku Zafrul also saying that foreign players were "knocking on our doors" to participate.

    ['area', 'internet', 'government', 'say', 'money']



  • KING GIVES CONSENT TO 14 LAWS PASSED BY PARLIAMENT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/03/king-gives-consent-to-14-laws-passed-by-parliament/31353

    10/03/2022, 12:35

    42.86% Shortened!

    Dewan Rakyat speaker Tan Sri Azhar Azizan Harun said the other laws are the Malaysian Border Control Agency (Dissolution) Act 2022, the Employment Insurance System (Amendment) Act 2022, the Employees” Social Security (Amendment) Act 2022 and the East Coast Economic Region Development Council (Amendment) Act 2022

    In addition, the Control of Rice and Padi (Amendment) Act 2022, the Offenders Compulsory Attendance (Amendment) Act 2022, the Federal Agricultural Marketing Authority (Amendment) Act 2022, the Courts of Justicature (Amendment) Act 2022 and the Criminal Procedure Code (Amendment) Act 2022

    His Majesty also consented to the National Forestry (Amendment) Act 2022, the Armed Forces Fund (Amendment) Act 2022, the Poisons (Amendment) Act 2022 and the Housewives' Social Security Act 2022

    He also conveyed a message from Dewan Negara president Tan Sri Dr Rais Yatim on the approval by the Senate to all the 25 bills passed by the Dewan Rakyat

    In addition, the Control of Rice and Padi (Amendment) Act 2022, the Offenders Compulsory Attendance (Amendment) Act 2022, the Federal Agricultural Marketing Authority (Amendment) Act 2022, the Courts of Justicature (Amendment) Act 2022 and the Criminal Procedure Code (Amendment) Act 2022

    His Majesty also consented to the National Forestry (Amendment) Act 2022, the Armed Forces Fund (Amendment) Act 2022, the Poisons (Amendment) Act 2022 and the Housewives' Social Security Act 2022

  • MALAYSIAN ROADS 12TH WORST IN THE WORLD, SECOND DEADLIEST — STUDY

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/malaysian-roads-12th-worst-world-second-deadliest-%E2%80%94-study

    10/03/2022, 10:03

    44.44% Shortened!

    In data released on Monday (Oct 3), the firm said Malaysian road quality has decreased by over 5% in the last five years

    “Over 22 road traffic fatalities per 100,000 have occurred on Malaysia's highways — the second highest number of road traffic deaths in the world after Saudi Arabia,” it said

    The road quality score has dropped by more than 20% in five years. It was 4.6 in 2014, and dropped to 3.7 by 2019

    Kuwait also has the third highest number of road traffic deaths per 100,000 people at almost 19

    It has the best road quality, as well as the fewest road traffic deaths at 1.69 per 100,000 people

    ['search', 'edge', 'high', 'road', 'quality']

    In data released on Monday (Oct 3), the firm said Malaysian road quality has decreased by over 5% in the last five years

    “Over 22 road traffic fatalities per 100,000 have occurred on Malaysia's highways — the second highest number of road traffic deaths in the world after Saudi Arabia,” it said

    The road quality score has dropped by more than 20% in five years. It was 4.6 in 2014, and dropped to 3.7 by 2019

    Kuwait also has the third highest number of road traffic deaths per 100,000 people at almost 19

    It has the best road quality, as well as the fewest road traffic deaths at 1.69 per 100,000 people

    ['search', 'edge', 'high', 'road', 'quality']



  • MACC CONCERNED BY RISE IN NUMBER OF WOMEN NABBED FOR CORRUPTION, SAYS AZAM

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/03/macc-concerned-by-rise-in-number-of-women-nabbed-for-corruption-says-azam

    10/03/2022, 09:34

    47.62% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    The MACC chief commissioner said the number of corruption cases with women as the perpetrators was on the rise

    When I first joined the organisation, which was then known as BPR (Badan Pencegah Rasuah), there was hardly a woman arrested for corruption in a year

    "Corruption is about people who have power, the people who are given the trust and responsibility, ” he said in an interview here recently

    The MACC was established on Oct 1, 1967

    It was formerly known as the Anti-Corruption Agency (BPR) before becoming an independent commission in 2009

    When asked about political funding, Azam said there was a need to formulate a law on it to expedite the requirements for politicians and political parties to declare the funds they received

    Whether political funding was lawful or not depends on the definition in the law, which may differ from one country to another, he said

    In Malaysia, he said, there was no law yet governing funds received by politicians and political parties

    Therefore, it is not a crime for politicians and political parties to accept political funding and donations, he said, adding that they could accept political donations from corporations or individuals, provided the money is not from unlawful sources

    Azam said the commission received many complaints about political entities receiving funds in the form of bribes

    ['corruption', 'macc', 'woman', 'say', 'azam']

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    The MACC chief commissioner said the number of corruption cases with women as the perpetrators was on the rise

    When I first joined the organisation, which was then known as BPR (Badan Pencegah Rasuah), there was hardly a woman arrested for corruption in a year

    "Corruption is about people who have power, the people who are given the trust and responsibility, ” he said in an interview here recently

    The MACC was established on Oct 1, 1967

    It was formerly known as the Anti-Corruption Agency (BPR) before becoming an independent commission in 2009

    When asked about political funding, Azam said there was a need to formulate a law on it to expedite the requirements for politicians and political parties to declare the funds they received

    Whether political funding was lawful or not depends on the definition in the law, which may differ from one country to another, he said

    In Malaysia, he said, there was no law yet governing funds received by politicians and political parties

    Therefore, it is not a crime for politicians and political parties to accept political funding and donations, he said, adding that they could accept political donations from corporations or individuals, provided the money is not from unlawful sources

    Azam said the commission received many complaints about political entities receiving funds in the form of bribes

  • INTERACTIVE: WITH GE15 IMMINENT, HERE ARE ALL THE LAWS PASSED BY MALAYSIA'S 14TH PARLIAMENT SO FAR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/03/interactive-with-ge15-imminent-here-are-all-the-laws-passed-by-malaysias-14th-parliament-so-far

    10/03/2022, 08:34

    56.0% Shortened!

    KUALA LUMPUR, July 28 -- Members of Parliament voted for the Constitution (Amendment) Bill (No

    Among others, the MOU outlined an anti-party hopping law and that Parliament was not to be dissolved before that date

    A prior constitutional amendment in July 2019 which was also unanimously passed in Parliament saw the lowering of the minimum voting age to 18 from 21, as well as allowing for automatic voter registration

    The law, which has been gazetted and in force since Dec 15 last year, will allow 21.2million Malaysians to vote in GE15

    A total of 29 new bills have been passed by the House, which included the long-awaited Anti-Sexual Harassment Bill, which will allow victims of sexual harassment (verbal, non-verbal, visual, gestural or physical) to report the harassment and have their case heard in a closed-door tribunal

    What’s ahead Friday’s tabling of Budget 2023 will be a key focus of Parliament, along with the tabling of the Control of Tobacco Product and Smoking Bill 2022, which seeks to prohibit those born on and after Jan 1, 2007, from purchasing or possessing cigarettes or vape products

    Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin said he was confident that the Bill, which is still being reviewed and studied by a Parliamentary Select Committee, will receive the support of the majority of MPs

    On Aug 2, the Dewan Rakyat agreed that the Tobacco Product and Smoking Control Bill 2022 be referred to a Parliamentary Select Committee to examine and make recommendations for improvement, when the Bill was in its second reading

    The Bill was deemed by some MPs to be limiting freedom of choice after it was tabled in July

    The Bill is among eight bills that have been tabled for its first reading in Parliament this year

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['parliament', 'amendment', 'bill', 'mp', 'pass']

    KUALA LUMPUR, July 28 -- Members of Parliament voted for the Constitution (Amendment) Bill (No

    Among others, the MOU outlined an anti-party hopping law and that Parliament was not to be dissolved before that date

    A prior constitutional amendment in July 2019 which was also unanimously passed in Parliament saw the lowering of the minimum voting age to 18 from 21, as well as allowing for automatic voter registration

    The law, which has been gazetted and in force since Dec 15 last year, will allow 21.2million Malaysians to vote in GE15

    A total of 29 new bills have been passed by the House, which included the long-awaited Anti-Sexual Harassment Bill, which will allow victims of sexual harassment (verbal, non-verbal, visual, gestural or physical) to report the harassment and have their case heard in a closed-door tribunal

    What’s ahead Friday’s tabling of Budget 2023 will be a key focus of Parliament, along with the tabling of the Control of Tobacco Product and Smoking Bill 2022, which seeks to prohibit those born on and after Jan 1, 2007, from purchasing or possessing cigarettes or vape products

    Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin said he was confident that the Bill, which is still being reviewed and studied by a Parliamentary Select Committee, will receive the support of the majority of MPs

    On Aug 2, the Dewan Rakyat agreed that the Tobacco Product and Smoking Control Bill 2022 be referred to a Parliamentary Select Committee to examine and make recommendations for improvement, when the Bill was in its second reading

    The Bill was deemed by some MPs to be limiting freedom of choice after it was tabled in July

    The Bill is among eight bills that have been tabled for its first reading in Parliament this year

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['parliament', 'amendment', 'bill', 'mp', 'pass']



  • WHAT BUDGET 2023 HAS TO OFFER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/03/what-budget-2023-has-to-offer

    10/03/2022, 07:35

    68.57% Shortened!

    However, this time around, everyone will be keenly watching out for what may come immediately after the tabling of the Budget – the dissolution of the Parliament

    Malaysians, say political observers, are looking forward to seeing what is in store for them and what the coalition government under Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob has got to offer in Budget 2023

    “This is perhaps the first time that there are people who are more interested in waiting for the Prime Minister’s Parliament dissolution announcement than the Budget itself

    According to the Parliament website, the Supply (Budget) Bill 2023 will be tabled by Finance Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz at 4pm this Friday

    If everything goes on to plan, Budget 2023 will then be approved by Dewan Rakyat

    “I do not want a ‘miscarriage’ of the Budget that will only be tabled and then for the Parliament to be immediately dissolved

    “Then, we will have to re-table it again by the new government after the 15th General Election,” he said, predicting the Budget 2023 to be full of “election goodies”

    While the tabling of the Budget is one of the most significant events of the year for the Parliament – without which there will be no money to run the government or the country – this meeting is also chock-full of other important Bills, such as the Anti-Stalking Bill, which women activists have fought for, as well as the Control of Tobacco Products and Smoking Bill 2022, also known as the Generation End Game Bill

    This was after the contentious Bill, which was supposed to be passed in the last meeting, was referred to the committee on Aug 2

    Others slotted for a first reading are the Road Transport Bill (Amendments) 2022, Land Public Transport Bill (Amendments) 2022 and the Vehicle Trade Licensing Board (Amendments) 2022 Bill

    Also on the table is the motion for the election of a Deputy Speaker for the Dewan Rakyat to replace Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said, which has been postponed for the fourth time

    ['table', 'budget', 'also', 'bill', 'parliament']

    However, this time around, everyone will be keenly watching out for what may come immediately after the tabling of the Budget – the dissolution of the Parliament

    Malaysians, say political observers, are looking forward to seeing what is in store for them and what the coalition government under Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob has got to offer in Budget 2023

    “This is perhaps the first time that there are people who are more interested in waiting for the Prime Minister’s Parliament dissolution announcement than the Budget itself

    According to the Parliament website, the Supply (Budget) Bill 2023 will be tabled by Finance Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz at 4pm this Friday

    If everything goes on to plan, Budget 2023 will then be approved by Dewan Rakyat

    “I do not want a ‘miscarriage’ of the Budget that will only be tabled and then for the Parliament to be immediately dissolved

    “Then, we will have to re-table it again by the new government after the 15th General Election,” he said, predicting the Budget 2023 to be full of “election goodies”

    While the tabling of the Budget is one of the most significant events of the year for the Parliament – without which there will be no money to run the government or the country – this meeting is also chock-full of other important Bills, such as the Anti-Stalking Bill, which women activists have fought for, as well as the Control of Tobacco Products and Smoking Bill 2022, also known as the Generation End Game Bill

    This was after the contentious Bill, which was supposed to be passed in the last meeting, was referred to the committee on Aug 2

    Others slotted for a first reading are the Road Transport Bill (Amendments) 2022, Land Public Transport Bill (Amendments) 2022 and the Vehicle Trade Licensing Board (Amendments) 2022 Bill

    Also on the table is the motion for the election of a Deputy Speaker for the Dewan Rakyat to replace Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said, which has been postponed for the fourth time

  • WHAT ALL THAT STEALING SAYS ABOUT AMERICA

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/what-all-that-stealing-says-about-america-120048324.html

    77.55% Shortened!

    I recently went to my neighborhood drug store in New York City to buy some Tylenol and saw it was locked up on a plastic shelf—as was much of the store’s stock

    According to the 2022 National Retail Federation’s Retail Security Survey, the average "shrink rate" — otherwise known as inventory loss — last year was 1.4%, or roughly $94.5 billion out of $6.6 trillion in total retail sales

    But I don’t think it’s that simple

    First of all, a significant portion of retail crime goes unreported

    Not so much anymore

    “Organized retail crime has definitely been ticking up over the last few years,” says Mike Combs, director of asset protection, organized retail crime and central Investigations team at The Home Depot

    The company said that store closures, driven in part by excessive theft, were a factor

    And below is from a Target store in San Francisco per Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi

    “We take a multi-layered approach to combating organized retail crime,” Brian Harper-Tibaldo, senior manager of crisis communications for Target, told Yahoo Finance

    “This includes in-store technology, training for store leaders and security team members, and partnerships with local, state and federal law enforcement agencies as well as retail trade associations.” Why are people stealing these days? That’s a tough one

    “This is a problem for all of us, because it raises prices for all of us,” says Mark Mathews, of the National Retail Federation

    ['store', 'steal', 'retail', 'say', 'get']

    I recently went to my neighborhood drug store in New York City to buy some Tylenol and saw it was locked up on a plastic shelf—as was much of the store’s stock

    According to the 2022 National Retail Federation’s Retail Security Survey, the average "shrink rate" — otherwise known as inventory loss — last year was 1.4%, or roughly $94.5 billion out of $6.6 trillion in total retail sales

    But I don’t think it’s that simple

    First of all, a significant portion of retail crime goes unreported

    Not so much anymore

    “Organized retail crime has definitely been ticking up over the last few years,” says Mike Combs, director of asset protection, organized retail crime and central Investigations team at The Home Depot

    The company said that store closures, driven in part by excessive theft, were a factor

    And below is from a Target store in San Francisco per Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi

    “We take a multi-layered approach to combating organized retail crime,” Brian Harper-Tibaldo, senior manager of crisis communications for Target, told Yahoo Finance

    “This includes in-store technology, training for store leaders and security team members, and partnerships with local, state and federal law enforcement agencies as well as retail trade associations.” Why are people stealing these days? That’s a tough one

    “This is a problem for all of us, because it raises prices for all of us,” says Mark Mathews, of the National Retail Federation

    https://www.goal.com/en/news/live/transfer-news-and-rumours-live-/blt76e2387858dd9377

    10/03/2022, 07:03

    52.17% Shortened!

    The Italy international, who continues to see a move to England speculated on, turned down those advances as he wanted to prove himself at Juventus

    Callum Wilson has signed a new contract at Newcastle, reports The Athletic

    The Athletic reports that more good news is on the way for Manchester City, with Phil Foden poised to sign a new contract

    The England international forward is set to commit to terms at the Etihad Stadium that will keep him in his current surroundings for six more years

    The France international forward spent time on loan in Andalusia last season and could be lured back to Spain in January

    Nicolo Zaniolo is set to sign a new contract at Roma - according to Calciomercato

    The 23-year-old has been linked with a number of clubs, including Juventus and Tottenham, with his current contract due to expire in 2024

    The Serie A side need to invest in a new left-back and see the Empoli man as an ideal option to strengthen their options in the position

    Metro reports the Premier League side are in the hunt for a candidate to replace David de Gea and see him as an interesting option

    The 52-year-old coach recently left Olympiacos and could become the third consecutive Portuguese coach to manage the Premier League side

    Ndicka looks set to leave the German side at the end of the season when his contract expires, while Polish defender Kiwior could be tempted to make the step up to a top Serie A team.

  • CHINA’S $5 TRILLION ROUT CREATES HISTORIC GAP WITH INDIAN STOCKS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/china-5-trillion-rout-creates-010000495.html

    69.44% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- The relentless plunge in China’s stocks has burnished the appeal of their biggest emerging-market rival India, spurring a divergence that’s rarely been seen before

    The 33-percentage point outperformance by the India gauge is the biggest since March 2000

    And India -- long dubbed the “next China” -- has become an attractive alternative with economic growth that’s forecast to be the fastest in Asia

    Market veteran Mark Mobius has allocated a higher weight to India than China since the start of this year

    Jupiter Asset Management says some of its emerging-market funds have India as their largest holding

    M&G Investments (Singapore) Pte has made a “greater allocation” to India in 2022

    The MSCI India Index -- which reached an all-time high earlier this year -- has added about $300 billion

    is targeting India as one of its top markets to expand globally

    “We think this is really India’s moment

    Regardless of how the Chinese market performs, abrdn Plc.’s Kristy Fong said India’s attractiveness to global investors remains a long-term trend

    “As a stock market, India is home to some of the highest quality companies in the region, with some of the most capable management teams anywhere in Asia,” she said

    ['china', 'stock', 'market', 'india', 'say']

    (Bloomberg) -- The relentless plunge in China’s stocks has burnished the appeal of their biggest emerging-market rival India, spurring a divergence that’s rarely been seen before

    The 33-percentage point outperformance by the India gauge is the biggest since March 2000

    And India -- long dubbed the “next China” -- has become an attractive alternative with economic growth that’s forecast to be the fastest in Asia

    Market veteran Mark Mobius has allocated a higher weight to India than China since the start of this year

    Jupiter Asset Management says some of its emerging-market funds have India as their largest holding

    M&G Investments (Singapore) Pte has made a “greater allocation” to India in 2022

    is targeting India as one of its top markets to expand globally

    “As a stock market, India is home to some of the highest quality companies in the region, with some of the most capable management teams anywhere in Asia,” she said

    10/03/2022, 05:04

    57.69% Shortened!

    Many Liverpool fans would agree that Jürgen Klopp and Liverpool need to make a fairly significant tactical change if they're to make any major strides this season

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters Next weekend, Liverpool face a daunting test

    But there might just be something Jürgen Klopp can take from his opposite number Mikel Arteta to shore his Liverpool side up

    At Liverpool, by contrast, the set-up is often more aggressive

    At times, then, Liverpool can find themselves with one fewer player in their ‘safety net’

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    Sign up to the Liverpool.com newsletter here — it only takes a few seconds! If Liverpool were to implement the same model, it would probably look a little different

    Rather than having two full-backs in the three, Alexander-Arnold would position himself alongside Fabinho and Thiago

    Sustained use of a 2-3-5 might, then, be a natural evolution for this Klopp side

    But there are reasons to believe this might work for Liverpool, given Alexander-Arnold’s skillset and their current defensive frailties

    But if Liverpool continue to persist with their current set-up, then it’s hard to envisage a significant uplift in results.

    Sustained use of a 2-3-5 might, then, be a natural evolution for this Klopp side

  • ‘ARROGANT DELUDED TWERP’ – PIERS MORGAN RIPS INTO ‘DISGRACEFUL’ TEN HAG FOR HIS TREATMENT OF CRISTIANO RONA...

    https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/19984701/piers-morgan-ten-hag-ronaldo/

    10/03/2022, 05:03

    54.17% Shortened!

    PIERS MORGAN branded Erik ten Hag an "arrogant, deluded twerp" after the Manchester United manager left Cristiano Ronaldo on the bench against City

    Quizzed after the match about why he elected not to bring the Portuguese forward on, Ten Hag claimed it was "out of respect for his big career"

    you know Ronaldo would have been desperate to come on, whatever the score." Ronaldo has started just one Premier League match this season - the 4-0 hammering at Brentford in August

    After his side's defeat, Ten Hag claimed that his side didn't believe in themselves enough

    All the credit to City, but it's nothing to do with City "For me it was a surprise

    We were not on the front foot, we were not brave on the ball and there were spaces to play but we were not brave enough

    "All the credit to City, but it's nothing to do with City, our performance was not good

    We let our fans down, we let ourselves down and we're hugely disappointed."     ['pier', 'ten', 'hag', 'ronaldo', 'city']

    PIERS MORGAN branded Erik ten Hag an "arrogant, deluded twerp" after the Manchester United manager left Cristiano Ronaldo on the bench against City

    Quizzed after the match about why he elected not to bring the Portuguese forward on, Ten Hag claimed it was "out of respect for his big career"

    you know Ronaldo would have been desperate to come on, whatever the score." Ronaldo has started just one Premier League match this season - the 4-0 hammering at Brentford in August

    After his side's defeat, Ten Hag claimed that his side didn't believe in themselves enough

    All the credit to City, but it's nothing to do with City "For me it was a surprise

    We were not on the front foot, we were not brave on the ball and there were spaces to play but we were not brave enough

    "All the credit to City, but it's nothing to do with City, our performance was not good

    We let our fans down, we let ourselves down and we're hugely disappointed."   • KIM MIN-JAE IS A PERFECT PREMIER LEAGUE FIT WITH MAN UNITED REPORTEDLY TRACKING THE £44M-RATED STAR

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11243045/Kim-Min-jae-perfect-Premier-League-fit-Man-United-reportedly-tracking-44m-rated-star.html

    10/03/2022, 03:03

    65.62% Shortened!

    In Naples, Koulibaly was known for his explosive physical strength but it was used in conjunction with strong tactical intelligence.  Kim Min-jae has been a huge success since joining Napoli in the summer from Fenerbahce By contrast, Kim seems to prefer direct aggression - and it's working too

    Koulibaly is certainly among the strongest defenders in the world and will be remembered as a Napoli icon but Kim looks set to be even more useful to the Italian side.  Kim uses all the dark arts a defender can use during a game

    His aggressive form of defending has already rattled Premier League sides including Liverpool Kim's physical strength has been key in helping Napoli lead Serie A in the early stages this term Standing at 190cm and about 88kg, moving Kim is like trying to shift Mount Vesuvius

    Despite his giant physique and aggressive nature, Kim appears to stick to the rules

    Kim is inspired by Sergio Ramos and Fabio Cannavaro but soon dreams of inheriting the leadership of Koulibaly

    Kim though has not allowed such a move to hinder his game - he appears to now thrive on the pressure

    Kim is focused precisely on his career and his move from Fenerbahce underlines his desire to become an elite player

    Rival clubs could soon be showing interest in Kim though as in his 40-page contract there is a €50m (£44m) release clause

    Considering his physical attributes, Kim would be the ideal player in any top international club but would probably be perfectly at home in the Premier League

    Manchester United have shown interest in Kim, who has been compared to club captain Harry Maguire in terms of his strength but of having greater concentration Kim signed a contract of three years plus another 24 months on top as an option to Napoli

    Kim has the physique of Harry Maguire but compared to the English defender he has exceptional concentration which makes him difficult to overcome

    ['napoli', 'look', 'like', 'already', 'kim']

  • SHELL MOTORSPORT COLLECTION LIMITED EDITION SET OF 7 BLUETOOTH REMOTE CONTROL CARS IN MALAYSIA; RM30 EACH - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2022/10/03/shell-motorsport-collection-limited-edition-set-of-7-bluetooth-remote-control-cars-in-malaysia-rm30-each/

    10/03/2022

    57.69% Shortened!

    Here, the Shell Motorsport Collection offers a selection of Bluetooth remote control cars representing various marques campaigning in partnership with Shell in motorsport, joining storied Italian supercar marque Ferrari in this collection of remote control scale models

    The remote control aspect is via Bluetooth control, which enable users to control the scale models through their mobile devices

    What will these cost? To purchase these scale models individually, customers will need to purchase a minimum of RM50 in Shell fuels, in order to be eligible to purchase the models at RM30 each

    These however do not include the smart battery which is sold separately at RM30, which enables Bluetooth remote control of the models

    With the purchase of a four-litre pack of Shell Helix engine oil, customers will receive the exclusive Ferrari SF90 F1 scale model for free, along with the Bluetooth smart battery

    Meanwhile, purchasing a minimum of RM80 worth of Shell V-Power Racing petrol (at participating stations) will make the buyer eligible to purchase the exclusive collector’s box for RM80

    In conjunction with the launch of this Shell Motorsport Collection, Shell Malaysia will be holding events at KL Sentral from October 17 to 23, as well as at the Mid Valley Megamall from October 26 to 30, and these venues will be where the public will get to try out all seven remote control scale models on a specially designed course

    Ferrari SF90 F1 BMW M4 Motorsport Nissan Formula E Gen 2 Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC Australian Supercars Shell V-Power Racing Team Ford Mustang GT Team Penske Indycar NASCAR Team Penske Ford Mustang GT Comments The Ferraris I collected last time now also collecting dust

    Shell must be inhaling too much petrol fumes

    Li Ion Battery sold separately to prevent unintended fires

    As a Setel hardcore user, to get this I need to spend RM50 on petrol, RM30 for a car and another RM30 for the battery

    ['shell', 'collection', 'control', 'car', 'model']

  • JIN WEI FAILS TO WIN IN VIETNAM, BUT COACH SAYS SHE'S ON RIGHT COMEBACK TRAIL

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/badminton/2022/10/03/jin-wei-fails-to-win-in-vietnam-but-coach-says-shes-on-right-comeback-trail

    10/03/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    Jin Wei, who had to play in three games in her previous two rounds, was served a blow by Vietnam’s Nguyen Thuy Linh with a 21-15, 21-13 win in 32 minutes

    It was the 22-year-old’s first defeat to the world No

    Nova said it was heartwarming to see Jin Wei complete a tournament without breaking down and believed she would be in a position to win a title soon

    “I’m satisfied with Jin Wei’s performance

    To me, it is a victory,” said Nova

    “Jin Wei needs to slowly work her way up and be mindful with her fitness and avoid injuries

    “She can also avoid playing in the qualifying rounds.” Jin Wei is ranked 50th in the world

    The two-time world junior champion will take a one-week break before returning to two competitions – Indonesia International (Oct 11-16) and the Indonesia Masters (Oct 18-23) in Malang

    Jin Wei has not won any major title although she had reigned as the country’s best before she was affected by her stomach ailment in 2019

    For now, Jin Wei will have to continue her career without an international title but Nova expects it to change soon

    ['jin', 'wei', 'vietnam', 'win', 'world']

    Haaland, 22, has 14 goals in the Premier League this season -- more goals than 14 other teams in the league -- and 17 goals in 11 games across all competitions for City

    Haaland has pulled level with the United forward after just eight games

    There was something poignant about the fact that Ronaldo spent the full 90 minutes on the United substitutes' bench as Haaland tore his team apart

    His numbers pale into insignificance when compared with Haaland's

    But Haaland's absence from the World Cup is only likely to make him and City better this season

    United were the first Big Six team to face City and Haaland this season

    Sheffield United (10 a.m

    ET) United had no answer to Haaland, but Foden was equally potent and damaging to Erik ten Hag's team

    United got away with it, but another team will be less fortunate

    Erling Haaland is simply unplayable right now and, if he maintains his form, City will win everything this season.

  • SHOPEE LAYOFFS: TECH REDUNDANCIES NECESSARY FOR INDUSTRY, SAY ANALYSTS

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/tech-redundancies-layoffs-shopee-sea-employment-2982126

    10/03/2022

    77.08% Shortened!

    While volatility is expected to remain high in the tech sector, job seekers with relevant skills are highly sought after as demand for tech talents exceed supply in Asia

    "Labour mobility is a necessary part of the tech ecology

    You join another tech company, and that in a way is how tech keeps innovating,” he said

    “Even if the current company doesn't work out, you as an individual, you picked up skills, knowledge, experience

    Among the firms that have cut manpower is Shopee’s parent company Sea Limited

    “I think Sea has been growing really, really fast the last few years, they were going for growth versus efficiency

    And as what we've seen in Chinese tech companies, (restructuring) is something that happens every year,” she noted.

    If Sea had waited two or three more years, the restructuring would have been a lot more painful than now.” The layoffs in the tech industry come following pandemic-fuelled growth in the sector

    “So there’s the whole tech boom that’s sort of unique to the pandemic

    But I think now they are actually becoming more prudent

    While volatility is expected to remain high in the tech sector, job seekers with relevant skills are highly sought after as demand for tech talents exceeds supply in Asia, according to consulting firm Mercer

    ['tech', 'company', 'year', 'say', 'think']

    And as what we've seen in Chinese tech companies, (restructuring) is something that happens every year,” she noted.

  • CHINA ON COURSE TO ELUDE US CHIP-MAKING EQUIPMENT BANS

    https://asiatimes.com/2022/10/china-on-course-to-elude-us-chip-making-equipment-bans/

    10/03/2022

    75.56% Shortened!

    The US is intent on rebuilding its own semiconductor industry and denying China technology with advanced military or other national security-related applications – the first and prime example being Huawei’s telecom equipment

    So what can China do about America’s sanctions and bans? It has been widely reported that China cannot make leading-edge semiconductor devices without EUV lithography equipment from ASML of the Netherlands and electronic design automation (EDA) tools from Synopsis and Cadence of America or Siemens (Mentor Graphics) of Germany

    It’s also been reported that China couldn’t make semiconductors at all without production equipment from America’s Applied Materials and Lam Research or inspection equipment from the California-based KLA

    China is a rival and has been ever since the US took the side of the Nationalists in China’s civil war

    For China, that means double down on industrial policies to develop advanced technologies

    Industry association SEMI lists about 80 Chinese companies involved in semiconductor equipment research and manufacturing – and all of them can be assumed to receive government support

    Only 17% of Chinese semiconductor demand was met by production in China and only 7% by Chinese companies

    These figures show the market opportunity for Chinese semiconductor design, manufacturing and production equipment companies, and the corresponding opportunity cost for foreign companies hamstrung by US government export restrictions

    That appears to be China’s window of opportunity

    Sometime in the second half of the decade, we will know whether the US government’s attempt to stifle China’s semiconductor industry has succeeded or failed

    Failure seems likely, except at the leading edge, and the cost for America and its semiconductor companies will likely be very high

    ['chinese', 'make', 'semiconductor', 'equipment', 'china']

    The US is intent on rebuilding its own semiconductor industry and denying China technology with advanced military or other national security-related applications – the first and prime example being Huawei’s telecom equipment

    ['chinese', 'make', 'semiconductor', 'equipment', 'china']



  • AIRASIA APOLOGISES AFTER VIDEO GOES VIRAL OF PARAPLEGIC PASSENGER CRAWLING ACROSS CABIN FLOOR

    https://www.marketing-interactive.com/airasia-apologises-paraplegic-passenger-crawl

    10/03/2022

    59.26% Shortened!

    AirAsia has apologised for a paraplegic passenger having to crawl across the cabin to get to his wheelchair when the plane landed at Changi Airport

    He was also clutching a seat handle for support

    The video was accompanied by a caption which explained that the passenger landed at Changi Airport with AirAsia QZ268 from Jakarta on 29 September and were asked to pay SG$40 for an aisle wheelchair when the passenger's seat was only three metres away from the exit

    AirAsia is unable to reveal guest details due to privacy laws

    Statistics by Meltwater from 30 September to 3 October showed that chatter surrounding this issue spiked on 30 September and the top keywords included "video of paraplegic", "down aisle", "passenger, "aisle wheelchair", and "disabled man aisle"

    A wheelchair service from Indonesia to Singapore costs approximately IDR120,000 (SG$11)

    AirAsia also contributed 36% of the complaints surrounding flight cancellations

    Customer experience is no doubt an important aspect of a customer's relationship with brands

    The study also revealed that 66% of customers are less patient than last year, while 64% of companies say customer service has a direct impact on business performance

    To remain on top, companies need to evolve the role of customer experience by rethinking the role of support teams

    They are also 62% more likely to find sales opportunities during customer interactions compared to starters, which are still relatively early in their customer experience maturity

    ['airasia', 'passenger', 'wheelchair', 'aisle', 'also']

    He was also clutching a seat handle for support

    AirAsia also contributed 36% of the complaints surrounding flight cancellations

    The study also revealed that 66% of customers are less patient than last year, while 64% of companies say customer service has a direct impact on business performance

    To remain on top, companies need to evolve the role of customer experience by rethinking the role of support teams

    They are also 62% more likely to find sales opportunities during customer interactions compared to starters, which are still relatively early in their customer experience maturity

  • 2023 TOYOTA COROLLA UPDATED IN JAPAN – MORE POWERFUL HYBRID SYSTEM; 1.5L AND 2.0L DYNAMIC FORCE ENGINES - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2022/10/03/2023-toyota-corolla-updated-in-japan/

    10/03/2022

    75.0% Shortened!

    As before, three body styles are offered, including the regular Corolla (sedan), Corolla Touring (wagon) and Corolla Sport (hatchback), all of which benefit from visual, mechanical and equipment revisions

    The Corolla and Corolla Touring both share the same face as the Levin sold in China (we get the European look in Malaysia), and this has been tweaked so the large lower intake no longer has a honeycomb insert

    As for the Corolla Sport, which matches the hatchback European and United States customers get, it receives a more expressive front apron with more prominent fog lamp surrounds as well as an arrow-themed insert for its lower intake

    The hybrid powertrain comes with an e-CVT to send drive to the front wheels, although the Corolla and Corolla Touring can also be had with the E-Four all-wheel drive system that adds a rear 1WM electric motor with 41 PS and 84 Nm

    In addition to the revised hybrid powertrain, the Corolla and Corolla Touring also receive a new 1.5 litre Dynamic Force naturally-aspirated three-cylinder petrol engine to replace the previous 2ZR-FAE 1.8 litre NA four-cylinder unit

    To go along with the Dynamic Force engine, the Super CVT-i has been replaced with a Toyota’s Direct Shift-CVT

    Meanwhile, the Corolla Sport also gets a Dynamic Force engine to replace the previous 8NR-FTS 1.2 litre turbocharged four-pot (116 PS and 185 Nm)

    The Corolla retails for between 1.99 and 2.998 million yen (RM63,756 and RM96,050) in Japan, while the Corolla Touring is from 2.07 to 3.048 million yen (RM66,319 to RM97,652) and the Corolla Sport is priced between 2.2 and 2.89 million yen (RM70,485 and RM92,592)

    At Japan, the Civic & Mazda3 is low

    No turbo no fun

    Honda is now ancient technology but missing features Bring corolla hybrid Hybrid is fine

    ['car', 'toyota', 'corolla', 'three', 'get']

  • AIRLINES' FLIGHT PLANS SHOW SINGAPORE'S CHANGI AIRPORT VOLUME SHOULD REACH 80% OF 2019 LEVELS BY YEAR END

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/03/airlines039-flight-plans-show-singapore039s-changi-airport-volume-should-reach-80-of-2019-levels-by-year-end

    10/03/2022

    57.69% Shortened!

    Monday, 03 Oct 2022

    The recent reopening of Hong Kong, Taiwan and Japan is likely to further increase year-end flights

    Already, the recent reopening of Hong Kong, Taiwan and Japan is likely to further increase year-end flights, as airlines respond to demand from Asian travellers, he said

    Pre-Covid-19, China accounted for about 20 per cent of Singapore's tourists

    "We plan with the capacity in mind, but we also need to be vigilant." He was responding to questions from Sharael Taha (Pasir Ris-Punggol GRC) and Saktiandi Supaat (Bishan-Toa Payoh GRC), who were concerned about Changi Airport's capacity to handle higher year-end flight volumes during the winter season

    Saktiandi was also worried that the authorities might have over-budgeted when it set the target for 80 per cent of pre-Covid-19 flights by the year end

    Mr Iswaran said there is predictability to these figures, which are derived from airlines when they submit to Changi Airport for flight slots that they operate

    He had said previously that the sector wanted to hire another 4,000 people by the year end, restoring manpower to 90 per cent of 2019 levels

    From Oct 30, there will be an additional daily service to Tokyo’s Haneda Airport, bringing the number of flights SIA operates daily to Japan’s capital to four

    There will also be a second daily flight to Osaka

    The service to Fukuoka will increase to three flights per week

    ['year', 'end', 'flight', 'airline', 'changi']
