  • ASIAN STARS NAME PENANG LAKSA, KLANG BAK KUT TEH AS FAVORITE CULTURAL DIPLOMACY FOOD

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/01/asian-stars-name-penang-laksa-klang-bak-kut-teh-as-favorite-cultural-diplomacy-food

    10/01/2022

    42.11% Shortened!

    Nam, who named Laksa for his choice, concurred with Golding that it would be the Penang version

    Feel like I really like Laksa," said Nam, before Golding suggested the Penang version to be specific to which Nam responded with a 'Yes!'

    Meanwhile for Golding, it would be Bak Kut Teh, the Klang version

    "Bak Kut Teh is my go to

    But, the Klang version

    "But Klang's is like this broth that's been brewing for generations

    "If it stops boiling, it will grow like this thickness of just fur and bacteria but it’s delicious

    Local netizens have expressed surprise and praised both their responses, Golding for not forgetting his Malaysian roots and Nam for selecting a Malaysian dish

    Some fans even praised Golding for pronouncing Klang properly.

    Klang Bak Kut Teh

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

  • SHOT FIRED AT CAR PARKED OUTSIDE HOME

    https://www.thesundaily.my/home/shot-fired-at-car-parked-outside-home-YH9900634

    10/01/2022

    42.86% Shortened!

    Perak police chief Datuk Mohd Yusri Hassan Basri (pix) said a man called the police at 1.07 pm yesterday to inform about the incident

    “The police rushed to the scene and according to the house owner, who is staying with his wife and two children, his wife had heard an explosion outside the house earlier in the morning, but ignored it

    Mohd Yusri said a team from the Forensic Division (D10) of the Criminal Investigation Department of the Perak Police Contingent Headquarters was at the scene and found a hole in the rear window of the victim’s car, believed to be from gun shots, as well as a bullet casing

    He said the police were investigating the case under Section 8 of the Firearms (Increased Penalty) Act 1971

    ['police', 'investigate', 'incident', 'house', 'mohd']

  • THIS IS HOW MUCH A $200,000 ANNUITY WILL SCORE YOU MONTHLY

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-does-200-000-annuity-120000015.html

    72.5% Shortened!

    An annuity can be an appealing option to build your retirement nest egg

    But the exact amount that you’ll get from an annuity each month will vary

    What Is an Annuity? An annuity is a financial contract between an investor and an insurance company that generally locks in a regular monthly payout in exchange for an investment

    You can buy an annuity if you want a guaranteed source of income for any situation

    An immediate annuity kicks in right away

    But you’ll typically see a higher monthly payment with a deferred annuity

    If you sign up for a fixed annuity, you’ll lock in guaranteed monthly payments

    If you sign up for a variable annuity, you won’t find guaranteed monthly payments

    Should You Get an Annuity? Depending on your financial circumstances, an annuity could be a reliable stream of income for your retirement

    An annuity sends a monthly payment to you every month

    If you can’t decide whether or not an annuity is right for you then it’s time to talk to a financial advisor

    ['annuity', 'retirement', 'income', 'financial', 'monthly']

    An annuity can be an appealing option to build your retirement nest egg

    But the exact amount that you’ll get from an annuity each month will vary

    What Is an Annuity? An annuity is a financial contract between an investor and an insurance company that generally locks in a regular monthly payout in exchange for an investment

    You can buy an annuity if you want a guaranteed source of income for any situation

    An immediate annuity kicks in right away

    But you’ll typically see a higher monthly payment with a deferred annuity

    If you sign up for a fixed annuity, you’ll lock in guaranteed monthly payments

    If you sign up for a variable annuity, you won’t find guaranteed monthly payments

    Should You Get an Annuity? Depending on your financial circumstances, an annuity could be a reliable stream of income for your retirement

    An annuity sends a monthly payment to you every month

    If you can’t decide whether or not an annuity is right for you then it’s time to talk to a financial advisor

    ['annuity', 'retirement', 'income', 'financial', 'monthly']



  • WHAT DID WARREN BUFFETT SAY HE'D WRITE A $25 BILLION CHECK FOR?

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/did-warren-buffett-hed-write-170745580.html

    65.62% Shortened!

    You may even know from his documentary “Becoming Buffett” that his No

    What you may have missed though, was the Oracle of Omaha’s fancy for farmland

    One of Gates’s biggest bets lately has been farmland

    At that same shareholders’ meeting alluded to previously, the example Buffett gave as the anti-Bitcoin was farmland

    for a 1% interest in all the farmland in the United States, pay our group $25 billion, I’ll write you a check this afternoon,” Buffett said during the meeting

    ”[For] $25 billion I now own 1% of the farmland

    That’s bad news if you’re looking to buy a house for yourself but great news if you’re looking for property as an investment

    If you are able to purchase a property outright and on your own, that may be the best option

    But it’s not just Gates or Buffett — even Goldman Sachs sees an opportunity with farmland

  • TOP APPLE EXECUTIVE IS LEAVING AFTER MAKING CRUDE REMARKS IN TIKTOK VIDEO

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/top-apple-executive-leaving-making-185638195.html

    54.17% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- One of Apple Inc.’s most senior executives is leaving after he turned up in a viral video on TikTok making an off-color joke that he fondles “big-breasted women” for a living

    5, Apple’s Tony Blevins was approached by TikTok and Instagram creator Daniel Mac as part of a series where he asks owners of expensive cars their occupations

    He also touted that he has a “hell of a dental plan.” In reality, Blevins is Apple’s vice president of procurement and is in charge of striking deals with suppliers and partners

    Blevins, a 22-year veteran of Apple, confirmed the incident to Bloomberg, saying the encounter took place on Aug

    An Apple spokesman said Thursday that Blevins is departing the Cupertino, California-based company

    Blevins has been part of a roughly 100-person group of vice presidents at Apple and one of only about 30 executives that report to either Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook or Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams

    Williams has been Blevins’s boss for much of his career, though he briefly reported to Sabih Khan, Apple’s senior vice president of operations, according to the people

    It was Williams’s decision for the company and Blevins to part ways, one of the people said

    The operating chief will oversee Blevins’s old team, at least for now, according to the person

    The TikTok video was taken at a car show that Blevins attended last month in Pebble Beach, California

    Blevins’s departure opens up a void at Apple

    ['apple', 'executive', 'video', 'blevins', 'say']

    (Bloomberg) -- One of Apple Inc.’s most senior executives is leaving after he turned up in a viral video on TikTok making an off-color joke that he fondles “big-breasted women” for a living

    5, Apple’s Tony Blevins was approached by TikTok and Instagram creator Daniel Mac as part of a series where he asks owners of expensive cars their occupations

    He also touted that he has a “hell of a dental plan.” In reality, Blevins is Apple’s vice president of procurement and is in charge of striking deals with suppliers and partners

    Blevins, a 22-year veteran of Apple, confirmed the incident to Bloomberg, saying the encounter took place on Aug

    An Apple spokesman said Thursday that Blevins is departing the Cupertino, California-based company

  • HOUSE DEMOCRATS HAVE OFFICIALLY DRAFTED A BILL THAT BANS POLITICIANS, JUDGES, THEIR SPOUSES AND CHILDREN FROM TRADING STOCKS — BUT HERE'S WHAT THEY'RE STILL ALLOWED TO OWN AND DO

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/house-democrats-officially-drafted-bill-154500661.html

    56.0% Shortened!

    Democrats have introduced legislation that would ban senior government officials from owning and trading stocks

    The bill, called the Combating Financial Conflicts of Interest in Government Act, is an attempt to limit conflict of interest for public office holders and their families when it comes to their investments

    The proposed bill is wide reaching

    And while it doesn’t make them clairvoyant, it’s certainly an advantage when it comes to the market

    Senior officials and others affected by the bill will be required to either sell their holdings when they take their position or put them into a blind trust, where they would have no control over trades

    Critics have been calling for such a bill for years, but the House and Senate have long resisted

    It happened soon before the Senate was expected to vote on a bipartisan bill that would see domestic chipmakers get a $52 billion subsidy

    The bill was passed in July and, amid the scrutiny, Paul Pelosi sold his holdings in the semiconductor manufacturer at a six-figure loss

    But months before that summer scandal, as calls for legislation to combat the issue mounted, Nancy Pelosi directed the House Administration Committee to draft a bill back in February

    The feeling that the well-connected in Congress have a leg up on the market has been growing over the years

    But it may be a while yet before Congress makes a decision on the bill

    ['would', 'senior', 'bill', 'call', 'come']

    Democrats have introduced legislation that would ban senior government officials from owning and trading stocks

    The bill, called the Combating Financial Conflicts of Interest in Government Act, is an attempt to limit conflict of interest for public office holders and their families when it comes to their investments

    The proposed bill is wide reaching

    And while it doesn’t make them clairvoyant, it’s certainly an advantage when it comes to the market

    Senior officials and others affected by the bill will be required to either sell their holdings when they take their position or put them into a blind trust, where they would have no control over trades

    Critics have been calling for such a bill for years, but the House and Senate have long resisted

    It happened soon before the Senate was expected to vote on a bipartisan bill that would see domestic chipmakers get a $52 billion subsidy

    The bill was passed in July and, amid the scrutiny, Paul Pelosi sold his holdings in the semiconductor manufacturer at a six-figure loss

    But months before that summer scandal, as calls for legislation to combat the issue mounted, Nancy Pelosi directed the House Administration Committee to draft a bill back in February

    The feeling that the well-connected in Congress have a leg up on the market has been growing over the years

    But it may be a while yet before Congress makes a decision on the bill

    ['would', 'senior', 'bill', 'call', 'come']



  • HOW MUCH MONEY DO I NEED TO LIVE ENTIRELY OFF DIVIDENDS? HERE IS THE LOWEST AMOUNT YOU CAN PROBABLY GET AWAY WITH

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-money-live-entirely-off-182000078.html

    67.65% Shortened!

    But how much money do you realistically need to be able to drop out of the workforce and get by on dividend payouts alone? While you will have to start by honestly assessing what you can live with — and without

    But there’s a simple formula and some less simple risks you’ll need to consider when making the big dividend-dependency decision

    For straight-up equity investors, those cash payouts fuel dividend income — where passively generated payouts cover your living expenses

    How much you’ll need exactly depends on your income, spending habits and living expenses

    But once you know how much you’ll need to live, here’s a simple formula to apply that to sort out how much you need in total

    Next, consider what you can reasonably expect from dividend yields

    It’s fair to plan on yield rates between 1% and 6%

    Dividend payments from a taxable brokerage account, or traditional 401(k) and IRA accounts, are considered taxable income

    If you think you can manage expenses at a median dividend income, then planning is everything

    Handled carefully, the pursuit of steady, sustainable dividend income can be a winning play

    For older Americans, living off dividend income could make sense, especially if it delays taking a Social Security benefit

    ['portfolio', 'income', 'need', 'dividend', 'company']

    For straight-up equity investors, those cash payouts fuel dividend income — where passively generated payouts cover your living expenses

    But once you know how much you’ll need to live, here’s a simple formula to apply that to sort out how much you need in total

    For older Americans, living off dividend income could make sense, especially if it delays taking a Social Security benefit

  • JIM CRAMER SAYS BUY THESE 2 HIGH-YIELD DIVIDEND STOCKS — INCLUDING ONE WITH 10% YIELD

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/jim-cramer-says-buy-2-002323365.html

    80.0% Shortened!

    This, in turn, brings Cramer to a specific investment choice -- high-yield dividend stocks

    Drilling down, Devon reported net income of $1.9 billion, or $2.59 per diluted share

    Even better, for investors, was the $2.1 billion in free cash flow reported for 2Q22, a company record for Devon

    This was up 22% from the previous quarter, and the highest single dividend that Devon has ever paid

    Based on the current dividend yield and the expected price appreciation, the stock has ~102% potential total return profile

    This gives the stock a Moderate Buy analyst consensus rating

    (See DVN stock forecast on TipRanks) KeyCorp (KEY) We’ll shift our focus now, as Cramer’s second high-yielding div stock is a Bancorp, KeyCorp, the holding company with ownership of KeyBank

    In the recent second quarter of 2022, the company had total revenue of $1.8 billion, well in the $1.7 billion to $2 billion range it has hit for the past 8 quarters

    This was down from the 72 cents reported in the year-ago quarter, but still solidly profitable – and more than enough to cover the 19.5 cent per common share dividend payment

    Buy) rating, as well as a $29 price target that indicates potential for 79% upside in the next 12 months

    The stock’s average price target of $22.19 gives ~37% upside to the current price of $16.17

    ['high', 'cramer', 'dividend', 'stock', 'devon']

  • LIVERPOOL: JURGEN KLOPP UNDERSTANDS WHY 'WORLD CLASS' TRENT ALEXANDER-ARNOLD IS SNUBBED BY ENGLAND

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11266959/Jurgen-Klopp-admits-understands-World-class-Trent-Alexander-Arnold-snubbed-England.html

    09/30/2022, 23:03

    56.0% Shortened!

    Klopp was respectful of Southgate and would not be drawn into discussions about the selections he made for his team, insisting that whatever he said would not help England's chances of being successful at the World Cup finals

    Jurgen Klopp has insisted Trent Alexander-Arnold is 'world class' despite recent form What Klopp could not hold back on, though, was the notion that Alexander-Arnold is somehow deficient in his defensive capabilities and he was incredulous that he would pick the 23-year-old if he was somehow lacking in key qualities to play the position

    While Liverpool's manager did concede that Alexander-Arnold has been below form at times this season - as has been the case for his team in general - the belief he has in a young man who has only been capped 17 times by England could not be higher

    'It helps Germany, maybe, it doesn't help England

    'A manager picks a player, or not, which I would obviously decide differently but I'm not in charge of this team and that's how it is

    Whichever team I would coach in the moment, I would sign him because he is exceptional

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We’ll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['comment', 'klopp', 'england', 'would', 'team']

    Klopp was respectful of Southgate and would not be drawn into discussions about the selections he made for his team, insisting that whatever he said would not help England's chances of being successful at the World Cup finals

    Jurgen Klopp has insisted Trent Alexander-Arnold is 'world class' despite recent form What Klopp could not hold back on, though, was the notion that Alexander-Arnold is somehow deficient in his defensive capabilities and he was incredulous that he would pick the 23-year-old if he was somehow lacking in key qualities to play the position

    While Liverpool's manager did concede that Alexander-Arnold has been below form at times this season - as has been the case for his team in general - the belief he has in a young man who has only been capped 17 times by England could not be higher

    'It helps Germany, maybe, it doesn't help England

    'A manager picks a player, or not, which I would obviously decide differently but I'm not in charge of this team and that's how it is

    Whichever team I would coach in the moment, I would sign him because he is exceptional

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We’ll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['comment', 'klopp', 'england', 'would', 'team']



  • INJURED HARRY MAGUIRE RULED OUT OF MANCHESTER DERBY AS ERIK TEN HAG MAKES BOLD PREDICTION ABOUT UNDER-FIRE...

    https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/19967839/harry-maguire-injured-manchester-derby-erik-ten-hag/

    09/30/2022, 22:35

    50.0% Shortened!

    HARRY MAGUIRE has been ruled out of the Manchester derby with a hamstring injury, manager Erik ten Hag has confirmed

    The Man Utd skipper, 29, has been out of favour in recent weeks, with Ten Hag opting to select the pair of Lisandro Martinez and Raphael Varane instead

    And Ten Hag will once again be absolved of the dilemma whether to pick Maguire or not against rivals Man City as he is unavailable for selection

    "Even after he wasn't in the team he trained really well and the quality was there

    "You see his career, for Leicester and Manchester United almost 50 caps for England, performing really well, what you see is high potential

    FREE BETS AND SIGN UP DEALS - BEST NEW CUSTOMER OFFERS "Every player has room for improvement and if he believes in his skills he will quickly be back on the level that he had." Maguire is coming off the back of a nightmare performance for England during the international break

    Meanwhile, Ten Hag has been boosted by the return of Anthony Martial and Marcus Rashford, both of whom are back in training

  • U.S. CONSUMER SPENDING REBOUNDS IN AUGUST; INFLATION PICKS UP

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/u-consumer-spending-rebounds-august-124615715.html

    56.0% Shortened!

    Still, inflation picked up last month

    The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index rose 0.3% last month after dipping 0.1% in July

    In the 12 months through August, the PCE price index increased 6.2% after advancing 6.4% in July

    Excluding the volatile food and energy components, the PCE price index jumped 0.6% after being unchanged in July

    The so-called core PCE price index climbed 4.9% on a year-on-year basis in August after increasing 4.7% in July

    The Fed tracks the PCE price indexes for its 2% inflation target

    The consumer price index increased 8.3% year-on-year in August

    The Fed raised its median forecast for core PCE inflation to 4.5% this year from its previous estimate of 4.3% in June

    Inflation adjusted consumer spending barely rose in August

    That suggests consumer spending could be tepid this quarter after helping to blunt the drag on gross domestic product from a slow down in the pace of inventory accumulation in the second quarter

    The economy contracted at a 0.6% annualized rate last quarter after shrinking at a 1.6% pace in the January-March quarter

    ['consumer', 'august', 'inflation', 'quarter', 'increase']

    Still, inflation picked up last month

    The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index rose 0.3% last month after dipping 0.1% in July

    In the 12 months through August, the PCE price index increased 6.2% after advancing 6.4% in July

    Excluding the volatile food and energy components, the PCE price index jumped 0.6% after being unchanged in July

    The so-called core PCE price index climbed 4.9% on a year-on-year basis in August after increasing 4.7% in July

    The Fed tracks the PCE price indexes for its 2% inflation target

    The consumer price index increased 8.3% year-on-year in August

    The Fed raised its median forecast for core PCE inflation to 4.5% this year from its previous estimate of 4.3% in June

    Inflation adjusted consumer spending barely rose in August

    That suggests consumer spending could be tepid this quarter after helping to blunt the drag on gross domestic product from a slow down in the pace of inventory accumulation in the second quarter

    The economy contracted at a 0.6% annualized rate last quarter after shrinking at a 1.6% pace in the January-March quarter

    ['consumer', 'august', 'inflation', 'quarter', 'increase']



  • BODY OF KIDNAPPED WOMAN FOUND IN RAVINE, MAN ARRESTED

    https://www.thesundaily.my/local/body-of-kidnapped-woman-found-in-ravine-man-arrested-BE9897614

    09/30/2022, 20:34

    42.86% Shortened!

    Negeri Sembilan police chief DCP Ahmad Dzaffir Mohd Yusoff said the 27-year-old woman is believed to have been murdered

    Her remains were found by members of the public at about 3.30 pm

    “Based on the identity card and documents found with her as well as identification by family members, the body found is linked to a kidnapping case,” he said in a statement today

    He said following the discovery of the body, a man in his 20s was arrested in Ampang, Selangor on the same day to assist in the investigation

  • 2 ‘STRONG BUY’ DIVIDEND STOCKS YIELDING AT LEAST 8%

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/2-strong-buy-dividend-stocks-004214179.html

    79.63% Shortened!

    The company had a net income of $1.33 billion, an increase of $700 million year-over-year, or 90%

    For the second quarter of 2022, ET had a DCF of $1.88 billion, up a solid $500 million from the year-ago quarter

    This is the source of the company’s dividend, so the increase is important

    ET set its most recent dividend, for the second quarter of the year, paid out in August at 23 cents per common share

    This yield matches the current rate of inflation; investors can use this dividend to provide a stronger level of protection against the effects of price inflation

    Based on the current dividend yield and the expected price appreciation, the stock has ~45% potential total return profile

    The stock has a trading price of $10.97 and an average price target of $15.20, implying a one-year upside of ~39%

    Proceeds from these properties generated Q2 revenues of $70.5 million, for a 44% year-over-year increase

    These results meant that IIPR’s dividend is affordable – and in fact, management raised the dividend payment in the most recent declaration

    At that yield, it almost matches the rate of inflation

    Shares are trading for $88.09, and their $161.83 average target implies a one-year upside of ~84%

    ['rate', 'year', 'stock', 'dividend', 'company']

    44.44% Shortened!

    Frank Leboeuf says he was "disappointed" with Chelsea's performance in their 1-1 draw vs

    When asked for comment by ESPN, sources close to Nkunku insisted there was no agreement with Chelsea, or any other club, and any medical checks were routine for all players at the club

    Nkunku is believed to have a release clause in his contract set at €60 million that comes into effect in the summer of 2023

    Chelsea have indicated a willingness to meet that price, but no deal has yet been reached given other clubs are interested and the clause is not yet in effect

    Sources have told ESPN that Chelsea were keen on signing Nkunku this summer but that Leipzig wanted to keep him for another season and agreed a two-year contract extension with the player to 2026.

  • SENATORS ARE FIGHTING TO HELP YOU TO BUY MORE I BONDS SOON

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/senators-fighting-help-buy-more-185434555.html

    57.14% Shortened!

    For more help with planning your retirement, consider working with a financial advisor

    As of right now, you can purchase $10,000 in I bonds digitally each year, plus $5,000 in paper I bonds

    savings bonds - if you buy a $50 bond, you'll actually pay $50 for it

    There are a few loopholes to get around the $10,000 limit

    You can have your spouse purchase up to $10,000 as well, and if you have a business or trust you can also purchase up to $10,000 in the name of that entity

    New I Bond Legislation While I bonds will see the interest rate adjusted as usual in November, an even bigger change may be coming to the security - allowing people to buy more of them annually under certain conditions

    The new legislation - introduced by Sen

    They have a guaranteed interest rate and can last for various lengths of time

    Currently, you can only purchase up to $10,000 in I bonds each year

    Retirement Planning Tips For help with integrating I bonds into your retirement portfolio, consider working with a financial advisor

    Finding a qualified financial advisor doesn't have to be hard

    If you're ready to find an advisor who can help you achieve your financial goals, get started now

    ['bond', 'year', 'retirement', 'financial', 'advisor']

    You can have your spouse purchase up to $10,000 as well, and if you have a business or trust you can also purchase up to $10,000 in the name of that entity

    “Police received the report on the incident at 5.03pm

    Mohamad Farouk said the businessman sustained injuries on his face and feet and had received medical treatment at the Ampang Hospital

    The company’s main point of differentiation is efficiency

    A look at the revenues will show that this company is making a strong start

    Buy) rating on LOCL stock, as well as set a $13 price target

    At current levels, his target implies a one-year gain of a whooping 432%

    The shares are priced at $2.44 and have an average target of $10.20, suggesting an upside of 318% on the one-year horizon

    (See LOCL stock forecast at TipRanks) Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE) We’ll shift now to clean energy

    For the recent 2Q22, the company delivered a total of 50 million gallons, up from 42.9 million gallons in the year-ago quarter

    “As the leading natural gas fuel distributor in North America, CLNE is in a prime position to fuel the transportation sector’s transition to renewable energy

  • IS MALAYSIA PREPARED FOR GLOBAL ECONOMIC SHOCK?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/30/is-malaysia-prepared-for-global-economic-shock

    09/30/2022

    72.5% Shortened!

    THERE is a growing chorus sounding global recession alarm bells

    The World Bank has warned that simultaneous global rate hikes in response to inflation could trigger a recession in 2023

    With the risk of a global recession, especially in the United States and Europe being worried about, is Malaysia safer than we were during the Covid-19 pandemic crisis in 2020-2021 and the Global Financial Crisis in 2008-2009? The answer is Malaysia will be manageable but will not be fully insulated from an external economic shock if triggered by a global recession or a severe recession in the US economy and Europe

    Unemployment Domestic labour market has not fully recovered as July’s unemployment rate of 3.7% is still a distance from the pre-pandemic jobless rate of 3.3%

    In addition, skill-related (36.7% in second-quarter 2022 or 2Q22 versus 34.8% in 4Q19) and time-related (1.4% in 2Q22 versus 1.1% in 4Q19) underemployment is still a hindrance to a sustainable economic recovery

    Domestic demand Second is relying on domestic demand (private consumption and private investment), backed by public investment and government-linked investment companies’ investment

    Can the households brace for an economic slowdown? The job market and wage growth will slow

    On businesses, policymakers need to put in place measures to ease the constraints that confront labour market, cost of doing business, regulatory as well as compliance cost, and trade networks

    Both domestic financial and foreign exchange markets would witness persistent volatility arising from the negative spillover effects of the global financial markets if a recession hit major advanced economies

    Bank Negara will have the policy tools to ensure an orderly foreign exchange market and ensure sufficient domestic liquidity (both the ringgit and US dollar) to support the economy

    The monetary policy must be employed consistently to support domestic demand, in a timely manner, and to ensure price stability

    ['global', 'recession', 'economic', 'high', 'rate']

    THERE is a growing chorus sounding global recession alarm bells

    The World Bank has warned that simultaneous global rate hikes in response to inflation could trigger a recession in 2023

    With the risk of a global recession, especially in the United States and Europe being worried about, is Malaysia safer than we were during the Covid-19 pandemic crisis in 2020-2021 and the Global Financial Crisis in 2008-2009? The answer is Malaysia will be manageable but will not be fully insulated from an external economic shock if triggered by a global recession or a severe recession in the US economy and Europe

    Unemployment Domestic labour market has not fully recovered as July’s unemployment rate of 3.7% is still a distance from the pre-pandemic jobless rate of 3.3%

    In addition, skill-related (36.7% in second-quarter 2022 or 2Q22 versus 34.8% in 4Q19) and time-related (1.4% in 2Q22 versus 1.1% in 4Q19) underemployment is still a hindrance to a sustainable economic recovery

    Domestic demand Second is relying on domestic demand (private consumption and private investment), backed by public investment and government-linked investment companies’ investment

    Can the households brace for an economic slowdown? The job market and wage growth will slow

    On businesses, policymakers need to put in place measures to ease the constraints that confront labour market, cost of doing business, regulatory as well as compliance cost, and trade networks

    Both domestic financial and foreign exchange markets would witness persistent volatility arising from the negative spillover effects of the global financial markets if a recession hit major advanced economies

    Bank Negara will have the policy tools to ensure an orderly foreign exchange market and ensure sufficient domestic liquidity (both the ringgit and US dollar) to support the economy

    The monetary policy must be employed consistently to support domestic demand, in a timely manner, and to ensure price stability

    ['global', 'recession', 'economic', 'high', 'rate']



  • MAN PRETENDS TO BE HIS SON TO ASK TEEN GIRLS FOR NUDE PHOTOS ON INSTAGRAM

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2022/09/30/man-pretends-to-be-his-son-to-ask-teen-girls-for-nude-photos-on-instagram-us-cops-say

    09/30/2022, 16:05

    45.0% Shortened!

    The son told his mother that his father had been messaging girls on his Instagram account, asking for explicit photos, according to the report

    — Photo by Claudio Schwarz on Unsplash A Utah man has been charged with six counts of attempted sexual exploitation after being accused of using his son’s Instagram to ask for nude photos from minors

    The 39-year-old man’s ex-wife contacted the Brigham City Police Department to report that he had been using her son’s phone to message female teenagers, according to an incident report

    The son left his phone at his father’s home

    McClatchy News is not identifying the father to protect the identity of his son

    The son told his mother that his father had been messaging girls on his Instagram account, asking for explicit photos, according to the report

    On one occasion the man sent a photo of his leg during a conversation, police said

    The man sent a text to a juvenile on May 8, saying, “Your sexy as hell, send send me the sexiest picture you got,” according to the report

    “Let’s see what your working with?? Show me your goods,” the man said in another message, according to police

  • GEELY ACQUIRES 7.6% STAKE IN ASTON MARTIN LAGONDA - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2022/09/30/geely-acquires-7-6-stake-in-aston-martin-lagonda/

    09/30/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    In a statement, Geely Holding Group CEO Daniel Donghui Li said that Geely’s well-established track record and technology offerings would be able to contribute to Aston Martin’s future success

    Geely’s inclusion as a shareholder in Aston Martin Lagonda comes three months after Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund (PIF) took a 16.7% stake in the automaker, which has been beset with high debt in recent times

    Another significant shareholder is Mercedes-Benz, which presently has a 9.7% stake in Aston Martin after the capital increase made in July

    It was not disclosed how much representation Geely will have in terms of board seats

    Comments Proton Aston Habesla Britain dah jual to China! Oh wait, Jag & LR dah jual to India, Mini dah jual to Jerman, MG dah jual to China, Lotus & Caterham dah jual to Mesia.

    Habesla Britain no longer British, even their Finance Minister is an incompetent MP from Africa origin! Geely spreading its wings, and yet their own cars are not in significant markets yet

    Wonder why? Western bias of china

    U mean western companies can freely do anything they want in China such as buy Chinese companies? Imperialised, seriously In Todays world ? If it is one needs to look at how china operates

    No doubt Geely is being strategic and good for them in expanding their wings in a free market with level playing field

    120 years ago Britain came to China and conquered them through force.

    Now 120 years later, China came to Britain and conquered them through economics.

    ['aston', 'martin', 'geely', 'september', 'china']

    47.83% Shortened!

    Liverpool are considering signing young Egyptian attacker Ibrahim Adel in January

    90min report that Liverpool scouts were already ‘familiar’ with Adel before Salah’s recommendation, though

    But should Liverpool make a move, Adel would have to be loaned out

    As he wouldn’t be able to come into the first team straight away on account of work permit issues, Adel would be a signing for the future

    At twenty-one, he’s already broken into the Egyptian national team

    As far as comparisons go, it would feel lazy to lump him into the Salah bracket

    In that respect, perhaps a move to Liverpool wouldn’t do Adel much good

    Because he wouldn’t be able to play straight away, this may make it difficult for him to live up to that tag

    The figures involved make it no gamble at all for Liverpool

    If he develops as Salah did, he’ll make a fine player

    If not, Liverpool could still earn a good fee from him as they did with the likes of Taiwo Awoniyi, who never played for the club during a six-year spell

    Like Awoniyi, Adel looks set for a bright future in Europe whether that’s at Liverpool or elsewhere

    ['liverpool', 'egyptian', 'adel', 'salah', 'would']

    Liverpool are considering signing young Egyptian attacker Ibrahim Adel in January

    90min report that Liverpool scouts were already ‘familiar’ with Adel before Salah’s recommendation, though

    But should Liverpool make a move, Adel would have to be loaned out

    As he wouldn’t be able to come into the first team straight away on account of work permit issues, Adel would be a signing for the future

    At twenty-one, he’s already broken into the Egyptian national team

    As far as comparisons go, it would feel lazy to lump him into the Salah bracket

    In that respect, perhaps a move to Liverpool wouldn’t do Adel much good

    Because he wouldn’t be able to play straight away, this may make it difficult for him to live up to that tag

    The figures involved make it no gamble at all for Liverpool

    If he develops as Salah did, he’ll make a fine player

    If not, Liverpool could still earn a good fee from him as they did with the likes of Taiwo Awoniyi, who never played for the club during a six-year spell

    Like Awoniyi, Adel looks set for a bright future in Europe whether that’s at Liverpool or elsewhere

    ['liverpool', 'egyptian', 'adel', 'salah', 'would']



  • JAPAN'S NIKKEI FALLS 2%; ASIA-PACIFIC MARKETS SLIDE AFTER S&P 500 CLOSES AT NEW YEAR-LOW

    https://www.cnbc.com/2022/09/30/asia-markets-wall-street-china-pmi-stocks-currencies.html

    09/30/2022, 15:05

    80.7% Shortened!

    China's official factory activity data unexpectedly expanded in August, beating estimates

    In Japan, the Nikkei 225 slipped 1.83% to 25,937.21, and the Topix index fell 1.76% to 1,835.94

    Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company fell 2.41% and Largan Precision slumped 4.39%

    The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction

    PMI prints compare activity from month to month

    The official non-manufacturing PMI came in at 50.6 in September, down from 52.6 in August

    — Abigail Ng China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    — Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

    Data also provided by

    ['index', 'fell', 'inflation', 'month', 'bank']

    Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company fell 2.41% and Largan Precision slumped 4.39%

    The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction

    PMI prints compare activity from month to month

    The official non-manufacturing PMI came in at 50.6 in September, down from 52.6 in August

    — Abigail Ng China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    — Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

  • PEP GUARDIOLA DEMANDS MAN CITY BE 'PERFECT' TO WIN MAN UNITED CLASH

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/manchester-city-engman_city/story/4757241/pep-guardiola-demands-man-city-be-perfect-to-win-man-united-clash

    09/30/2022

    47.62% Shortened!

    Shaka Hislop reveals how he expects Erik ten Hag to counter the threat of Man City's Erling Haaland

    Manchester United have only lost two of their last eight visits to the Etihad Stadium, winning three of the last four, and Guardiola said he is wary of the threat posed by Erik ten Hag's team

    When you are anxious it is difficult to take the right one

    The quality they have is undoubted for many years." United have recovered from two defeats to start the season to move up to fifth in the table with four league wins in a row leading to Ten Hag being named Premier League manager of the month for September

    City, meanwhile, have started the campaign with five wins and two draws from their first seven games, but Guardiola said the derby atmosphere should lift his players to an even higher level against United

    "They [United] come from a very good result against Southampton away which is not easy and Arsenal at home, good momentum for them," he added

    "It's a big rivalry in the city and I will try to figure out what they are going to do and what we can do to beat them

    I'm looking forward to the game

    "[Stones] will not be four, five or six weeks [out], it will be less," Guardiola said

    "I don't know when he will come back, but I think maybe 10 days to two weeks

    "Hopefully [surgery] will solve the problem [with Phillips] and hopefully he is ready and can come back in time for the World Cup and after the World Cup, come back with us."

    ['city', 'guardiola', 'say', 'win', 'united']

    63.33% Shortened!

    Join Our Telegram Channel for More Insights

    Ripple (XRP) is undoubtedly a top-performing coin for this week

    The token is up 9% in the last 7 days and 33% in a month

    It staged a 100% price hike this week – higher than XRP’s 9% weekly gain

    Unlike XRP, Binance Coin (BNB) gets a sluggish price forecast not from exhaustion but from lack of momentum

    BNB fails to regain sellers’ attention after falling 22% from last year’s price

    BNB hiked 3% to $277.76 during the session

  • SALESMAN FINDS RED PAINT SPLASHED ON SISTER'S CAR IN IPOH

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/30/salesman-finds-red-paint-splashed-on-sister039s-car-in-ipoh

    09/30/2022, 13:04

    50.0% Shortened!

    Friday, 30 Sep 2022

    Red paint was splashed on a house and a neighbour car at Taman Cempaka Ipoh by the loan shark.The neighbour who park the car at the victim's house washing the vehichles splash with red paint

    “Because there were many of us, and not enough space to park our cars, I parked my sister’s car in front of the unoccupied house last night (Sept 29)

    “When I checked the car around 7am today, I was shocked to see red paint all over,” he said when Perak MCA public services and complaints bureau chief Low Guo Nan visited the place Friday (Sept 30)

    A note was found pasted near the front gate of the house with a message addressed to “Lew” with a WhatsApp number

    A man known as Lam, 67, who stays nearby, said his sister had passed away last month, and that Lew, who is in his 40s, had not even come back for her funeral

    “Six months ago, loan sharks had splashed paint inside the porch as well

    At that time, a tenant who parked his car on the porch, had red paint all over his car

    “Lew is nowhere to be found, and with my sister gone now, the house cannot be put on rent or sold as we fear the loan sharks will continue to harass those staying in that house,” he said

    Low hoped the police would take stern action and investigate the matter

    “Lam is afraid that the loan sharks may come back to burn the house or something worse could happen

    ['red', 'paint', 'house', 'car', 'loan']

    Low hoped the police would take stern action and investigate the matter

    “Lam is afraid that the loan sharks may come back to burn the house or something worse could happen

  • IRAN PROTESTS AND THE PRESSURE ON PLAYERS AT WORLD CUP

    https://global.espn.com/football/ir-iran/story/4756413/iran-protests-and-the-pressure-on-players-at-world-cup

    09/30/2022

    69.44% Shortened!

    Mark Ogden reports from outside the Lusail Stadium, which will host the World Cup final

    Long live Iranian women!" The reference was clear

    "I have to apologize to the players of the national team because I caused my dear friends to be annoyed some supporters even insulted the national team," he wrote

    It's already here and has been for a very long time

    And nothing is bigger than the World Cup that Iran will be participating this November in Qatar, where they're in a group with the United States, England and Wales

    The elephant in the room is what happens when Iran kick off their World Cup campaign against England on Nov

    But there is no "morality police" in Qatar -- at least not of the kind they have in Iran -- and Muslim women aren't forced to wear headscarves (though many do so by choice or custom)

    Iran is not in a position to compel Qatar to do anything and even less so while the world is watching, and it has pledged to be welcoming and inclusive (at least for the duration of the tournament)

    On the one hand, the vast majority have family, friends and business interests in Iran and could face repercussions back home if they take a public stand in Qatar

    These are the pressures facing Team Melli, six weeks removed from the World Cup

    Just don't tell them politics and social messaging have no place in football

    ['world', 'iran', 'take', 'team', 'iranian']

    Mark Ogden reports from outside the Lusail Stadium, which will host the World Cup final

    Long live Iranian women!" The reference was clear

    "I have to apologize to the players of the national team because I caused my dear friends to be annoyed some supporters even insulted the national team," he wrote

    It's already here and has been for a very long time

    And nothing is bigger than the World Cup that Iran will be participating this November in Qatar, where they're in a group with the United States, England and Wales

    The elephant in the room is what happens when Iran kick off their World Cup campaign against England on Nov

    But there is no "morality police" in Qatar -- at least not of the kind they have in Iran -- and Muslim women aren't forced to wear headscarves (though many do so by choice or custom)

    Iran is not in a position to compel Qatar to do anything and even less so while the world is watching, and it has pledged to be welcoming and inclusive (at least for the duration of the tournament)

    On the one hand, the vast majority have family, friends and business interests in Iran and could face repercussions back home if they take a public stand in Qatar

    These are the pressures facing Team Melli, six weeks removed from the World Cup

    Just don't tell them politics and social messaging have no place in football

    ['world', 'iran', 'take', 'team', 'iranian']

    09/30/2022, 10:45

    71.05% Shortened!

    China's official factory activity data unexpectedly expanded in August, beating estimates

    The index dropped 2.1% to end the session at 3,640.47

    China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index surprisingly grew in September to 50.1, much higher than the 49.6 predicted by analysts in a Reuters poll

    The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction

    PMI prints compare activity from month to month

    The official non-manufacturing PMI came in at 50.6 in September, down from 52.6 in August

    — Abigail Ng China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    — Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

  • REPORT: GE15 DATE DECISION ON THE CARDS AS UMNO SUPREME COUNCIL MEETS TONIGHT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/30/report-ge15-date-decision-on-the-cards-as-umno-supreme-council-meets-tonight/30895

    09/30/2022, 10:34

    60.71% Shortened!

    According to the report, Parliament may be dissolved as early as October 12

    The BN government under Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad made a similar move in 1999, tabling the Budget for the following year and then dissolving Parliament to pave the way for election before it was passed

    The 14th Parliament’s term will automatically end in July next year and a general election must be called within 60 days

    But it is understood that the general election this time could be held within four weeks of Parliament’s dissolution, depending on how many states with expiring mandates dissolve their respective legislatures

    Umno deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said in August that Ismail had said election would be held this year

    Ismail Sabri is Umno vice-president who broke party and national history by becoming prime minister instead of those above him in the hierarchy

    In 2018, then prime minister Najib Razak went almost the full five-year term, only announcing Parliament’s dissolution on April 6, weeks before his mandate expired

    Pakatan Harapan (PH) ended up with 121 seats in the 222-seat Parliament with Dr Mahathir becoming prime minister for the second time

    “It depends on the Election Commission but I think a general election this time will be held on a weekend, not a weekday like the last time or people will get angry again,” an Umno source told The Malaysian Insight

    Better to end this charade now and get a government with a clear mandate,” he added

    That coalition government fell apart when Bersatu president and prime minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin lost majority support in Parliament

    ['parliament', 'election', 'poll', 'government', 'year']

    According to the report, Parliament may be dissolved as early as October 12

    The BN government under Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad made a similar move in 1999, tabling the Budget for the following year and then dissolving Parliament to pave the way for election before it was passed

    The 14th Parliament’s term will automatically end in July next year and a general election must be called within 60 days

    But it is understood that the general election this time could be held within four weeks of Parliament’s dissolution, depending on how many states with expiring mandates dissolve their respective legislatures

    Umno deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said in August that Ismail had said election would be held this year

    Ismail Sabri is Umno vice-president who broke party and national history by becoming prime minister instead of those above him in the hierarchy

    In 2018, then prime minister Najib Razak went almost the full five-year term, only announcing Parliament’s dissolution on April 6, weeks before his mandate expired

    Pakatan Harapan (PH) ended up with 121 seats in the 222-seat Parliament with Dr Mahathir becoming prime minister for the second time

    “It depends on the Election Commission but I think a general election this time will be held on a weekend, not a weekday like the last time or people will get angry again,” an Umno source told The Malaysian Insight

    Better to end this charade now and get a government with a clear mandate,” he added

    That coalition government fell apart when Bersatu president and prime minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin lost majority support in Parliament

  • ASIA MARKETS MIXED AFTER S&P 500 CLOSES AT NEW LOW FOR THE YEAR; CHINA FACTORY ACTIVITY EXPANDS

    https://www.cnbc.com/2022/09/30/asia-markets-wall-street-china-pmi-stocks-currencies.html

    09/30/2022, 09:56

    66.67% Shortened!

    China's official factory activity data unexpectedly expanded in August, beating estimates

    The index dropped 2.1% to end the session at 3,640.47

    China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    — Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    Retail sales also jumped 4.1% in August compared with a year ago, beating a Reuters forecast of a 2.8% rise

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

    "We're still not even in restrictive territory on the funds rate, so you're right, we've moved the funds rate up 300 basis points this year, but look how high inflation is," Mester said

    A Division of NBCUniversal Data is a real-time snapshot *Data is delayed at least 15 minutes

    Data also provided by

    ['data', 'index', 'high', 'also', 'inflation']

    The index dropped 2.1% to end the session at 3,640.47

    China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    — Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    Retail sales also jumped 4.1% in August compared with a year ago, beating a Reuters forecast of a 2.8% rise

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

    "We're still not even in restrictive territory on the funds rate, so you're right, we've moved the funds rate up 300 basis points this year, but look how high inflation is," Mester said

    China's factory activity data is due later today

    China's official manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    A private survey of Chinese factory activity is also due on Friday, and analysts polled by Reuters predict that the print will come in at 49.5

    — Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

  • NAJIB'S ACCOUNT 'SENSITIVE'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/30/najibs-account-sensitive

    09/30/2022, 09:04

    42.11% Shortened!

    “The transaction amount was large

    If the market actually knew in terms of this amount, definitely the market would have taken a position

    And it would affect the ringgit value,” said AmBank Private Banking capital market desk head, Yap Wai Keat, 57

    He said the account was also considered a “sensitive” one as the then prime minister was a politically exposed person (PEP)

    The prosecution witness said this during cross-examination by Najib’s lawyer Wan Aizuddin Wan Mohammed in the RM2.28bil 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) trial here yesterday

    Wan Aizuddin had asked Yap on how he knew the account ending 694, which had been given a code name “AmPrivate Banking – MR”, belonged to Najib

    Yap said he was informed by Najib’s AmBank relationship manager Joanna Yu that the Pekan MP was the beneficiary

    The witness was asked again by the lawyer on what made the account “sensitive”, and he replied that it was due to Najib being the prime minister at that time

    Yap said yesterday these were other reasons the account needed to be handled carefully

    “That’s why I think Joanna (Yu) created the code name for Datuk Seri’s account.” Najib, 69, is facing four charges of using his position to obtain bribes totalling RM2.28bil from 1MDB funds and 21 charges of money laundering involving the same amount.

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

    ['najib', 'account', 'amount', 'market', 'would']

    “The transaction amount was large

    If the market actually knew in terms of this amount, definitely the market would have taken a position

    And it would affect the ringgit value,” said AmBank Private Banking capital market desk head, Yap Wai Keat, 57

    He said the account was also considered a “sensitive” one as the then prime minister was a politically exposed person (PEP)

    The prosecution witness said this during cross-examination by Najib’s lawyer Wan Aizuddin Wan Mohammed in the RM2.28bil 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) trial here yesterday

    Wan Aizuddin had asked Yap on how he knew the account ending 694, which had been given a code name “AmPrivate Banking – MR”, belonged to Najib

    Yap said he was informed by Najib’s AmBank relationship manager Joanna Yu that the Pekan MP was the beneficiary

    The witness was asked again by the lawyer on what made the account “sensitive”, and he replied that it was due to Najib being the prime minister at that time

    Yap said yesterday these were other reasons the account needed to be handled carefully

    “That’s why I think Joanna (Yu) created the code name for Datuk Seri’s account.” Najib, 69, is facing four charges of using his position to obtain bribes totalling RM2.28bil from 1MDB funds and 21 charges of money laundering involving the same amount.

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

    ['najib', 'account', 'amount', 'market', 'would']



  • THE DERBY HAS BEEN FAR TOO EASY FOR MANCHESTER CITY RECENTLY... BUT THIS ONE WON'T BE

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/article-11264533/The-derby-far-easy-Manchester-City-recently-one-wont-be.html

    09/30/2022, 09:03

    80.0% Shortened!

    United had it when they began to dominate English football in the 1990s, the knowledge that they effectively just had to turn up and play properly to beat City

    City were brilliant, United’s prime task was keeping the score down

    With United having run eight miles fewer than Brentford, Ten Hag decided that the squad would make up the distance the following day

    Crucially, Ten Hag said he would do the run also

    Ten Hag is not the first manager to do this

    Such actions go a long way

  • SQUASHING LITTERBUGS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/metro/metro-news/2022/09/30/squashing-litterbugs

    09/30/2022, 08:34

    69.44% Shortened!

    COMMUTERS at the North Klang bus station in Selangor who are caught littering are immediately being made to do community service if they are unable to pay the RM10 fine

    Klang Municipal Council’s (MPK) Environmental Services Department director Zaireezal Ahmad Zainuddin said the council wants a litter-free town

    Statistics show that from January until Sept 18 this year, 93 litter louts were issued with fines while 53 others were made to pick up litter at the bus station area

    Zaireezal says the council wants to achieve a litter-free town

    He highlighted that rubbish bins were often only a few steps away but people chose to litter anyway

    Mohd Ali urges the council to intensify its anti-litter drive

    MPK enforcement officer in charge of the anti-litter squad, Aswarizal Mohd Wazib, said “Ops Kutu Sampah” had resulted in a bus station and five-foot ways that were much cleaner

    “Most of the rubbish around the bus station accumulates after work hours as those who wait for buses at North Klang bus station will eat fast food and leave the wrappers on the benches or the grass

    A man disposing of rubbish properly in the garbage bin at the Klang North Bus station

    Mohd Ali Jinnah echoed this sentiment and urged the local council to intensify its anti-litter drive

    He suggested a dedicated team be set up to monitor the bus station area and that the initiative be expanded to other public areas

    ['litter', 'klang', 'bus', 'station', 'fine']

    COMMUTERS at the North Klang bus station in Selangor who are caught littering are immediately being made to do community service if they are unable to pay the RM10 fine

    Klang Municipal Council’s (MPK) Environmental Services Department director Zaireezal Ahmad Zainuddin said the council wants a litter-free town

    Statistics show that from January until Sept 18 this year, 93 litter louts were issued with fines while 53 others were made to pick up litter at the bus station area

    Zaireezal says the council wants to achieve a litter-free town

    He highlighted that rubbish bins were often only a few steps away but people chose to litter anyway

    Mohd Ali urges the council to intensify its anti-litter drive

    MPK enforcement officer in charge of the anti-litter squad, Aswarizal Mohd Wazib, said “Ops Kutu Sampah” had resulted in a bus station and five-foot ways that were much cleaner

    Mohd Ali Jinnah echoed this sentiment and urged the local council to intensify its anti-litter drive

    He suggested a dedicated team be set up to monitor the bus station area and that the initiative be expanded to other public areas

  • SWEDE DEAL FOR PENANG

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/30/swede-deal-for-penang

    09/30/2022, 08:05

    52.17% Shortened!

    The expansion will also add 15 acres of land size to the facility, which is located within the state’s Penang Science Park

    “The expansion project is also expected to create an additional value of RM552mil in local sourcing of raw materials and components.” In the same statement, Penang Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow said the project will bring in investment, strengthen the socio-economy, increase job creation and provide opportunities for local talents to upskill

    “The investment will stimulate local businesses, thus contributing significantly towards the economy of Penang by maintaining and strengthening its local supply chains.” The investment is also set to create more engineering experts in the industrialised building system (IBS) for Penang

    Meanwhile, Malaysian Investment Development Authority (Mida) chief executive officer Datuk Arham Abdul Rahman said SIBS’ continued expansion demonstrated Malaysia’s strong economic fundamentals

    He said this included the country’s vibrant innovation ecosystem, particularly within the IBS industry, as well as Malaysia’s reliable infrastructure and connectivity to the region and the world

    “The company’s presence will also encourage the growth of local companies within the IBS industry,” he said

    Meanwhile, SIBS Group chief executive officer Erik Thomaeus said SIBS has put Malaysia on the map as the leading hub for the manufacturing-related construction industry

    “Using technology, the company has revolutionised a very conservative industry

    “The investment is important for Malaysia not only directly but also indirectly, in the thousands of jobs created in the supply chains around the country.” He noted that Malaysia is devoted to technology and companies built around “technical innovation.” “This is another proof of the genuine attractiveness of Malaysia as a hub for business and innovation

    “Our expansion in Malaysia will be divided in phases and eventually will achieve approximately RM500mil of total investment,” he said

    Meanwhile, Sweden’s ambassador to Malaysia Dr Joachim Bergstrom said Sweden is a pioneer in innovation and industry

    ['sib', 'penang', 'company', 'say', 'local']

  • STRONG GREENBACK A WELCOME SIGN FOR SOME MALAYSIANS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/30/strong-greenback-a-welcome-sign-for-some-malaysians

    09/30/2022, 08:05

    54.17% Shortened!

    Educator Felicia Chen, 27, said that with the strong US currency, she would be able to increase the usual amount of money she sends back home by at least 10%

    “With the same amount of US dollars, I am able to increase my savings and the money I send back home by at least 10% to 12%

    “However, I do send some money back on a quarterly basis to pay some bills,” she said, adding that she usually sent home an average of between US$200 (RM913.50) and US$400 (RM1,827) per month

    May Lee, 56, said the high exchange rate was timely as she had to pay for her mother’s healthcare expenses

    “My mother, who is in her 80s, had a bad fall last month and we are planning to put her in a nursing home to get better care

    “My children aged 21 and 23 are still studying here and I have to pay their fees (in the United States), so I might have to stretch my money

    “With the high exchange rate, it will make it easier for me to pay for these expenses,” she added

    “A healthy body breeds a healthy mind, and students need a healthy body, healthy mind and well-being to thrive and study well,” she said

    On the brighter side, Dr Chooi said students could see the high conversion rate as an opportunity to learn how to be smart consumers

    “Now is the best time to learn how to cook and make simple, nourishing meals at home during the weekends,” she said.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['high', 'money', 'home', 'say', 'well']

    Educator Felicia Chen, 27, said that with the strong US currency, she would be able to increase the usual amount of money she sends back home by at least 10%

    “With the same amount of US dollars, I am able to increase my savings and the money I send back home by at least 10% to 12%

    “However, I do send some money back on a quarterly basis to pay some bills,” she said, adding that she usually sent home an average of between US$200 (RM913.50) and US$400 (RM1,827) per month

    May Lee, 56, said the high exchange rate was timely as she had to pay for her mother’s healthcare expenses

    “My mother, who is in her 80s, had a bad fall last month and we are planning to put her in a nursing home to get better care

    “My children aged 21 and 23 are still studying here and I have to pay their fees (in the United States), so I might have to stretch my money

    “With the high exchange rate, it will make it easier for me to pay for these expenses,” she added

    “A healthy body breeds a healthy mind, and students need a healthy body, healthy mind and well-being to thrive and study well,” she said

    On the brighter side, Dr Chooi said students could see the high conversion rate as an opportunity to learn how to be smart consumers

    “Now is the best time to learn how to cook and make simple, nourishing meals at home during the weekends,” she said.

  • DOUBLE JOY FOR JUAN SHEN IN DEBUTS WITH NEW PARTNERS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/badminton/2022/09/30/double-joy-for-juan-shen-in-debuts-with-new-partners

    09/30/2022, 08:03

    54.17% Shortened!

    Independent player Juan Shen partnered Nur Mohd Azriyn Ayub in the men’s doubles and Goh Liu Ying in the mixed doubles for the first time

    Juan Shen also teamed up with Liu Ying to beat Vietnam’s Nguyen Anh Gia-Lam My Tien 21-16, 21-17 to set up a meeting with Indonesia’s Zachariah Sumanti-Hediana Julimarbela next

    In the men’s doubles, Mohd Haikal Nazri-Wan Arif Wan Junaidi also made it to the quarter-finals after overcoming compatriots Lee Yi Bo-Ling Wei Jie 21-12, 21-16

    Haikal-Arif will next meet independent shuttlers Goh V Shem-Lim Khim Wah

    Peng Soon-Yee See will face India’s Rohan Kapoor-N

    In the women’s singles, both Goh Jin Wei and S

    Jin Wei breezed past India’s Ira Sharma 21-18, 21-10 while Kisona had to fight tooth and nail to get past Myanmar’s Thet Thuzar 16-21, 21-18, 21-18

    Home players Vi Thi Anh and Thi Phuong Tran stand in the way of both Jin Wei and Kisona next and a win will set up an all-Malaysian affair

    Meanwhile, Cheam June Wei and Lee Shun Yang kept the flag flying in the men’s singles after both reached the quarter-finals

    June Wei defeated India’s Kiran Kumar 21-15, 21-10 in the third round while Shun Yang dashed the hopes of home player Le Manh Tran after claiming a 21-12, 21-15 victory

    June Wei will meet Taiwan’s Lee Chia-hao next while Shun Yang faces a tough challenge against China’s Sun Feixiang

  • PUTIN TO DECLARE ANNEXATION OF UKRAINIAN LANDS IN MAJOR ESCALATION OF WAR

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2022/09/30/putin-to-declare-annexation-of-ukrainian-lands-in-major-escalation-of-war/30867

    09/30/2022, 08:03

    42.11% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise LONDON, Sept 30 ― At a ceremony denounced by Ukraine as a “Kremlin freak show”, Russian President Vladimir Putin will proclaim the annexation of four Ukrainian regions today, escalating his seven-month war and taking it into an unpredictable new phase

    Putin will preside over a treaty-signing on “the entry of new territories into the Russian Federation”, three days after the completion of hastily staged referendums in which Moscow's proxies in the occupied regions claimed majorities of up to 99 per cent in favour of joining Russia

    But despite the triumphal setting, the annexation of the Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia and Kherson regions comes at a perilous moment for Putin

    After months of grinding, attritional warfare, Ukraine seized the initiative this month by routing Russian forces in the northeastern Kharkiv region

    Even staunch Kremlin allies have criticised the chaotic nature of the call-up, and Putin himself said on Thursday that “all mistakes must be corrected”

    Nuclear threat While it holds the vast majority of Luhansk and Kherson regions, Russia controls only about 60 per cent of Donetsk and 70 per cent of Zaporizhzhia, where fighting has raged close to Europe's biggest nuclear plant

    The hurried annexations mean front lines will now run through territory that Russia is declaring as its own, and which Putin has said he is ready to defend with nuclear weapons if necessary

    Some Western politicians called that a bluff ― something Putin explicitly denied

    The United States says it has warned Russia of catastrophic consequences if it did use a nuclear weapon

    Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak said yesterday that the Kremlin event was a “freak show”, and legally meaningless

    We are Russia.” The Kremlin has not yet said whether Putin will attend a celebratory concert on the square on Friday evening

    ['ukraine', 'kremlin', 'russian', 'putin', 'region']

    About Us Advertise LONDON, Sept 30 ― At a ceremony denounced by Ukraine as a “Kremlin freak show”, Russian President Vladimir Putin will proclaim the annexation of four Ukrainian regions today, escalating his seven-month war and taking it into an unpredictable new phase

  • ‘IT LOOKS LIKE DARWIN NUNEZ SHRINKED’: KLOPP WON’T HIDE HIS DISAPPOINTMENT AT LIVERPOOL PLAYER’S NEW HAIRCUT

    https://www.rousingthekop.com/2022/09/29/it-looks-like-darwin-nunez-shrinked-klopp-wont-hide-his-disappointment-at-liverpool-players-new-haircut/

    09/30/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    Kostas Tsimikas has a new haircut and it was the talk of Liverpool’s training session on Thursday

    The five minutes of footage is mostly about one thing, though – the new haircut of Kostas Tsimikas

    “A good day and now this,” says Klopp on seeing Tsimikas

    No one seems to dislike it more than Klopp does

    “Have a look at Kostas Tsimikas,” Klopp then warns the cameraman as he makes his way to the pitches

    “It looks like Darwin Nunez shrinked.” Not long later, Virgil van Dijk is telling Tsimikas “Kosti, he can’t say that to you, brother.” Presumably he means Klopp but by this point everyone is talking about it

    Tsimikas then wants Trent Alexander-Arnold and Mohamed Salah to assure him he doesn’t look like Darwin Nunez

    “Does it look like Darwin?” asks Tsimikas

    “Does he look like Darwin?” Salah asks the camera

    We do wonder how long Tsimikas will put up with this, though

    With the Greek set to start on Saturday, we won’t have to wait long to see if he’s willing to send a brutal, defiant message to Klopp and keep the hairstyle

  • POUND MAY NEED TO FALL TO PLUG THE HOLE OF UK'S INTERNATIONAL DEBT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/30/pound-may-need-to-fall-to-plug-the-hole-of-uks-international-debt

    09/30/2022, 07:03

    52.17% Shortened!

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive

    Five-year gilt yields are at around 4.6%, from only 3% earlier this month

    Around 25% of the gilt market is held by overseas investors, so government borrowing costs are very sensitive to capital that could easily find an alternative home (and some surely has already)

    When government borrowing costs rise, borrowing costs for the private sector rises –for companies through debt and loans, and for households principally through rising mortgage costs

    The government, or any company issuing debt now, will be locked in at a higher rate

    Ditto for any mortgage holder re-fixing

    As gilt yields rise, private-sector borrowing costs will also rise, damaging firms’ balance sheets and deterring investment

    On the top of that, mortgage holders will see their costs rise too

    Sterling is the release valve

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive enough

    Similarly, there will be a level of a sterling where UK holders of foreign assets find it attractive to repatriate the capital

    ['find', 'investor', 'borrowing', 'cost', 'sterling']

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive

    Five-year gilt yields are at around 4.6%, from only 3% earlier this month

    Around 25% of the gilt market is held by overseas investors, so government borrowing costs are very sensitive to capital that could easily find an alternative home (and some surely has already)

    When government borrowing costs rise, borrowing costs for the private sector rises –for companies through debt and loans, and for households principally through rising mortgage costs

    The government, or any company issuing debt now, will be locked in at a higher rate

    Ditto for any mortgage holder re-fixing

    As gilt yields rise, private-sector borrowing costs will also rise, damaging firms’ balance sheets and deterring investment

    On the top of that, mortgage holders will see their costs rise too

    Sterling is the release valve

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive enough

    Similarly, there will be a level of a sterling where UK holders of foreign assets find it attractive to repatriate the capital

    ['find', 'investor', 'borrowing', 'cost', 'sterling']



  • IGP: WOMAN KIDNAPPED IN TUMPAT RESCUED, BROUGHT HOME FROM THAILAND

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/30/igp-woman-kidnapped-in-tumpat-rescued-brought-home-from-thailand/30863

    09/30/2022, 06:35

    42.86% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 30 — A cosmetics product agent who was kidnapped at her home in Tumpat, Kelantan on Sept 13 has been safely rescued and brought home yesterday

    Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Acryl Sani Abdullah Sani said in a statement last night that the victim was rescued with the assistance and sharing of information between the Royal Malaysian Police (PDRM) and the Royal Thai Police who managed to detect the presence of the victim in the country

    He said PDRM thanked their Thai counterparts and the Malaysian embassy in the country for their assistance and aid in efforts to rescue the victim

    Acryl Sani said a vehicle believed to be used to kidnap the victim was also seized

    ['kuala', 'sept', 'kidnap', 'home', 'tumpat']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 30 — A cosmetics product agent who was kidnapped at her home in Tumpat, Kelantan on Sept 13 has been safely rescued and brought home yesterday

    Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Acryl Sani Abdullah Sani said in a statement last night that the victim was rescued with the assistance and sharing of information between the Royal Malaysian Police (PDRM) and the Royal Thai Police who managed to detect the presence of the victim in the country

    He said PDRM thanked their Thai counterparts and the Malaysian embassy in the country for their assistance and aid in efforts to rescue the victim

    Acryl Sani said a vehicle believed to be used to kidnap the victim was also seized
